Entries.Name: target
Entries.FieldDesc: A comma-separated list of components to run. The default value 'all' runs Loki in single binary mode. The value 'read' is an alias to run only read-path related components such as the querier and query-frontend, but all in the same process. The value 'write' is an alias to run only write-path related components such as the distributor and compactor, but all in the same process. Supported values: all, compactor, distributor, ingester, querier, query-scheduler, ingester-querier, query-frontend, index-gateway, ruler, table-manager, read, write. A full list of available targets can be printed when running Loki with the '-list-targets' command line flag.

Entries.Name: auth_enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: Enables authentication through the X-Scope-OrgID header, which must be present if true. If false, the OrgID will always be set to 'fake'.

Entries.Name: ballast_bytes
Entries.FieldDesc: The amount of virtual memory in bytes to reserve as ballast in order to optimize garbage collection. Larger ballasts result in fewer garbage collection passes, reducing CPU overhead at the cost of heap size. The ballast will not consume physical memory, because it is never read from. It will, however, distort metrics, because it is counted as live memory.

Entries.Name: server

Block.Name: server
Block.Desc: Configures the server of the launched module(s).

Entries.Name: http_listen_network
Entries.FieldDesc: HTTP server listen network, default tcp

Entries.Name: http_listen_address
Entries.FieldDesc: HTTP server listen address.

Entries.Name: http_listen_port
Entries.FieldDesc: HTTP server listen port.

Entries.Name: http_listen_conn_limit
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum number of simultaneous http connections, <=0 to disable

Entries.Name: grpc_listen_network
Entries.FieldDesc: gRPC server listen network

Entries.Name: grpc_listen_address
Entries.FieldDesc: gRPC server listen address.

Entries.Name: grpc_listen_port
Entries.FieldDesc: gRPC server listen port.

Entries.Name: grpc_listen_conn_limit
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum number of simultaneous grpc connections, <=0 to disable

Entries.Name: grpc_collect_max_streams_by_conn
Entries.FieldDesc: If true, the max streams by connection gauge will be collected.

Entries.Name: proxy_protocol_enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: Enables PROXY protocol.

Entries.Name: tls_cipher_suites
Entries.FieldDesc: Comma-separated list of cipher suites to use. If blank, the default Go cipher suites is used.

Entries.Name: tls_min_version
Entries.FieldDesc: Minimum TLS version to use. Allowed values: VersionTLS10, VersionTLS11, VersionTLS12, VersionTLS13. If blank, the Go TLS minimum version is used.

Entries.Name: cert
Entries.FieldDesc: Server TLS certificate. This configuration parameter is YAML only.

Entries.Name: key
Entries.FieldDesc: Server TLS key. This configuration parameter is YAML only.

Entries.Name: client_ca
Entries.FieldDesc: Root certificate authority used to verify client certificates. This configuration parameter is YAML only.

Entries.Name: cert_file
Entries.FieldDesc: HTTP server cert path.

Entries.FieldDesc: HTTP server key path.

Entries.Name: client_auth_type
Entries.FieldDesc: HTTP TLS Client Auth type.

Entries.Name: client_ca_file
Entries.FieldDesc: HTTP TLS Client CA path.

Entries.Name: cert
Entries.FieldDesc: Server TLS certificate. This configuration parameter is YAML only.

Entries.Name: key
Entries.FieldDesc: Server TLS key. This configuration parameter is YAML only.

Entries.Name: client_ca
Entries.FieldDesc: Root certificate authority used to verify client certificates. This configuration parameter is YAML only.

Entries.Name: cert_file
Entries.FieldDesc: GRPC TLS server cert path.

Entries.Name: key_file
Entries.FieldDesc: GRPC TLS server key path.

Entries.Name: client_auth_type
Entries.FieldDesc: GRPC TLS Client Auth type.

Entries.Name: client_ca_file
Entries.FieldDesc: GRPC TLS Client CA path.

Entries.Name: register_instrumentation
Entries.FieldDesc: Register the intrumentation handlers (/metrics etc).

Entries.Name: report_grpc_codes_in_instrumentation_label_enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: If set to true, gRPC statuses will be reported in instrumentation labels with their string representations. Otherwise, they will be reported as "error".

Entries.Name: graceful_shutdown_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: Timeout for graceful shutdowns

Entries.Name: http_server_read_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: Read timeout for entire HTTP request, including headers and body.

Entries.Name: http_server_read_header_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: Read timeout for HTTP request headers. If set to 0, value of -server.http-read-timeout is used.

Entries.Name: http_server_write_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: Write timeout for HTTP server

Entries.Name: http_server_idle_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: Idle timeout for HTTP server

Entries.Name: http_log_closed_connections_without_response_enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: Log closed connections that did not receive any response, most likely because client didn't send any request within timeout.

Entries.Name: grpc_server_max_recv_msg_size
Entries.FieldDesc: Limit on the size of a gRPC message this server can receive (bytes).

Entries.Name: grpc_server_max_send_msg_size
Entries.FieldDesc: Limit on the size of a gRPC message this server can send (bytes).

Entries.Name: grpc_server_max_concurrent_streams
Entries.FieldDesc: Limit on the number of concurrent streams for gRPC calls per client connection (0 = unlimited)

Entries.Name: grpc_server_max_connection_idle
Entries.FieldDesc: The duration after which an idle connection should be closed. Default: infinity

Entries.Name: grpc_server_max_connection_age
Entries.FieldDesc: The duration for the maximum amount of time a connection may exist before it will be closed. Default: infinity

Entries.Name: grpc_server_max_connection_age_grace
Entries.FieldDesc: An additive period after max-connection-age after which the connection will be forcibly closed. Default: infinity

Entries.Name: grpc_server_keepalive_time
Entries.FieldDesc: Duration after which a keepalive probe is sent in case of no activity over the connection., Default: 2h

Entries.Name: grpc_server_keepalive_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: After having pinged for keepalive check, the duration after which an idle connection should be closed, Default: 20s

Entries.Name: grpc_server_min_time_between_pings
Entries.FieldDesc: Minimum amount of time a client should wait before sending a keepalive ping. If client sends keepalive ping more often, server will send GOAWAY and close the connection.

Entries.Name: grpc_server_ping_without_stream_allowed
Entries.FieldDesc: If true, server allows keepalive pings even when there are no active streams(RPCs). If false, and client sends ping when there are no active streams, server will send GOAWAY and close the connection.

Entries.Name: grpc_server_num_workers
Entries.FieldDesc: If non-zero, configures the amount of GRPC server workers used to serve the requests.

Entries.Name: grpc_server_stats_tracking_enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: If true, the request_message_bytes, response_message_bytes, and inflight_requests metrics will be tracked. Enabling this option prevents the use of memory pools for parsing gRPC request bodies and may lead to more memory allocations.

Entries.Name: grpc_server_recv_buffer_pools_enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: Deprecated option, has no effect and will be removed in a future version.

Entries.Name: log_format
Entries.FieldDesc: Output log messages in the given format. Valid formats: [logfmt, json]

Entries.Name: log_level
Entries.FieldDesc: Only log messages with the given severity or above. Valid levels: [debug, info, warn, error]

Entries.Name: log_source_ips_enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: Optionally log the source IPs.

Entries.Name: log_source_ips_full
Entries.FieldDesc: Log all source IPs instead of only the originating one. Only used if server.log-source-ips-enabled is true

Entries.Name: log_source_ips_header
Entries.FieldDesc: Header field storing the source IPs. Only used if server.log-source-ips-enabled is true. If not set the default Forwarded, X-Real-IP and X-Forwarded-For headers are used

Entries.Name: log_source_ips_regex
Entries.FieldDesc: Regex for matching the source IPs. Only used if server.log-source-ips-enabled is true. If not set the default Forwarded, X-Real-IP and X-Forwarded-For headers are used

Entries.Name: log_request_headers
Entries.FieldDesc: Optionally log request headers.

Entries.Name: log_request_at_info_level_enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: Optionally log requests at info level instead of debug level. Applies to request headers as well if server.log-request-headers is enabled.

Entries.Name: log_request_exclude_headers_list
Entries.FieldDesc: Comma separated list of headers to exclude from loggin. Only used if server.log-request-headers is true.

Entries.Name: trace_request_headers
Entries.FieldDesc: Optionally add request headers to tracing spans.

Entries.Name: trace_request_exclude_headers_list
Entries.FieldDesc: Comma separated list of headers to exclude from tracing spans. Only used if server.trace-request-headers is true. The following headers are always excluded: Authorization, Cookie, X-Csrf-Token.

Entries.Name: http_path_prefix
Entries.FieldDesc: Base path to serve all API routes from (e.g. /v1/)

Entries.Name: label
Entries.FieldDesc: Optionally define the cluster validation label.

Entries.Name: enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: When enabled, cluster label validation is executed: configured cluster validation label is compared with the cluster validation label received through the requests.

Entries.Name: soft_validation
Entries.FieldDesc: When enabled, soft cluster label validation is executed. Can be enabled only together with server.cluster-validation.grpc.enabled

Entries.Name: enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: When enabled, cluster label validation is executed: configured cluster validation label is compared with the cluster validation label received through the requests.

Entries.Name: soft_validation
Entries.FieldDesc: When enabled, soft cluster label validation is executed. Can be enabled only together with server.cluster-validation.http.enabled

Entries.Name: excluded_paths
Entries.FieldDesc: Comma-separated list of url paths that are excluded from the cluster validation check.

Entries.FieldDesc: Enable writes to Kafka during Push requests.

Entries.FieldDesc: Enable writes to Ingesters during Push requests. Defaults to true.

Entries.Name: ingest_limits_enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: Enable checking limits against the ingest-limits service. Defaults to false.

Entries.Name: ingest_limits_dry_run_enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: Enable dry-run mode where limits are checked the ingest-limits service, but not enforced. Defaults to false.

Entries.Name: enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: Enable the tenant topic tee, which writes logs to Kafka topics based on tenant IDs instead of using multitenant topics/partitions.

Entries.Name: topic_prefix
Entries.FieldDesc: Prefix to prepend to tenant IDs to form the final Kafka topic name

Entries.Name: max_buffered_bytes
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum number of bytes that can be buffered before producing to Kafka

Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum size of a single Kafka record in bytes

Block.Desc: Configures the querier. Only appropriate when running all modules or just the querier.

Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum duration for which the live tailing requests are served.

Entries.Name: extra_query_delay
Entries.FieldDesc: Time to wait before sending more than the minimum successful query requests.

Entries.Name: query_ingesters_within
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum lookback beyond which queries are not sent to ingester. 0 means all queries are sent to ingester.

Entries.Name: max_look_back_period
Entries.FieldDesc: The maximum amount of time to look back for log lines. Used only for instant log queries.

Entries.Name: max_count_min_sketch_heap_size
Entries.FieldDesc: The maximum number of labels the heap of a topk query using a count min sketch can track.

Entries.Name: enable_v2_engine
Entries.FieldDesc: Experimental: Enable next generation query engine for supported queries.

Entries.Name: batch_size
Entries.FieldDesc: Experimental: Batch size of the next generation query engine.

Entries.Name: max_concurrent
Entries.FieldDesc: The maximum number of queries that can be simultaneously processed by the querier.

Entries.Name: query_store_only
Entries.FieldDesc: Only query the store, and not attempt any ingesters. This is useful for running a standalone querier pool operating only against stored data.

Entries.Name: query_ingester_only
Entries.FieldDesc: When true, queriers only query the ingesters, and not stored data. This is useful when the object store is unavailable.

Entries.Name: multi_tenant_queries_enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: When true, allow queries to span multiple tenants.

Entries.Name: per_request_limits_enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: When true, querier limits sent via a header are enforced.

Entries.Name: query_partition_ingesters
Entries.FieldDesc: When true, querier directs ingester queries to the partition-ingesters instead of the normal ingesters.

Entries.BlockDesc: Configures the querier. Only appropriate when running all modules or just the querier.

Entries.Name: query_scheduler

Block.Name: query_scheduler
Block.Desc: The query_scheduler block configures the Loki query scheduler. When configured it separates the tenant query queues from the query-frontend.

Entries.Name: max_outstanding_requests_per_tenant
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum number of outstanding requests per tenant per query-scheduler. In-flight requests above this limit will fail with HTTP response status code 429.

Entries.Name: max_queue_hierarchy_levels
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum number of levels of nesting of hierarchical queues. 0 means that hierarchical queues are disabled.

Entries.Name: querier_forget_delay
Entries.FieldDesc: If a querier disconnects without sending notification about graceful shutdown, the query-scheduler will keep the querier in the tenant's shard until the forget delay has passed. This feature is useful to reduce the blast radius when shuffle-sharding is enabled.

Entries.Name: username
Entries.FieldDesc: Etcd username.

Entries.Name: password
Entries.FieldDesc: Etcd password.

Entries.BlockDesc: Configuration for an ETCD v3 client. Only applies if the selected kvstore is etcd.

Entries.Name: primary
Entries.FieldDesc: Primary backend storage used by multi-client.

Entries.Name: secondary
Entries.FieldDesc: Secondary backend storage used by multi-client.

Entries.Name: mirror_enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: Mirror writes to secondary store.

Entries.Name: mirror_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: Timeout for storing value to secondary store.

Entries.Name: heartbeat_period
Entries.FieldDesc: Period at which to heartbeat to the ring. 0 = disabled.

Entries.Name: heartbeat_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: The heartbeat timeout after which compactors are considered unhealthy within the ring. 0 = never (timeout disabled).

Entries.Name: tokens_file_path
Entries.FieldDesc: File path where tokens are stored. If empty, tokens are not stored at shutdown and restored at startup.

Entries.Name: zone_awareness_enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: True to enable zone-awareness and replicate blocks across different availability zones.

Entries.Name: num_tokens
Entries.FieldDesc: IGNORED: Num tokens is fixed to 1

Entries.Name: replication_factor
Entries.FieldDesc: IGNORED: Replication factor is fixed to 2

Entries.Name: instance_id
Entries.FieldDesc: Instance ID to register in the ring.

Entries.Name: instance_interface_names
Entries.FieldDesc: Name of network interface to read address from.

Entries.Name: instance_port
Entries.FieldDesc: Port to advertise in the ring (defaults to server.grpc-listen-port).

Entries.Name: instance_addr
Entries.FieldDesc: IP address to advertise in the ring.

Entries.Name: instance_availability_zone
Entries.FieldDesc: The availability zone where this instance is running. Required if zone-awareness is enabled.

Entries.Name: instance_enable_ipv6
Entries.FieldDesc: Enable using a IPv6 instance address.

Entries.BlockDesc: The hash ring configuration. This option is required only if use_scheduler_ring is true.
The query_scheduler block configures the Loki query scheduler. When configured it separates the tenant query queues from the query-frontend.

Entries.Name: frontend

Block.Name: frontend
Block.Desc: The frontend block configures the Loki query-frontend.

Entries.Name: log_queries_longer_than
Entries.FieldDesc: Log queries that are slower than the specified duration. Set to 0 to disable. Set to < 0 to enable on all queries.

Entries.Name: log_query_request_headers
Entries.FieldDesc: Comma-separated list of request header names to include in query logs. Applies to both query stats and slow queries logs.

Entries.Name: max_body_size
Entries.FieldDesc: Max body size for downstream prometheus.

Entries.Name: query_stats_enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: True to enable query statistics tracking. When enabled, a message with some statistics is logged for every query.

Entries.Name: max_outstanding_per_tenant
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum number of outstanding requests per tenant per frontend; requests beyond this error with HTTP 429.

Entries.Name: querier_forget_delay
Entries.FieldDesc: In the event a tenant is repeatedly sending queries that lead the querier to crash or be killed due to an out-of-memory error, the crashed querier will be disconnected from the query frontend and a new querier will be immediately assigned to the tenants shard. This invalidates the assumption that shuffle sharding can be used to reduce the impact on tenants. This option mitigates the impact by configuring a delay between when a querier disconnects because of a crash and when the crashed querier is actually removed from the tenant's shard.

Entries.Name: scheduler_address
Entries.FieldDesc: DNS hostname used for finding query-schedulers.

Entries.Name: scheduler_dns_lookup_period
Entries.FieldDesc: How often to resolve the scheduler-address, in order to look for new query-scheduler instances. Also used to determine how often to poll the scheduler-ring for addresses if the scheduler-ring is configured.

Entries.Name: scheduler_worker_concurrency
Entries.FieldDesc: Number of concurrent workers forwarding queries to single query-scheduler.

Entries.Name: grpc_client_config

Block.Name: grpc_client
Block.Desc: The grpc_client block configures the gRPC client used to communicate between a client and server component in Loki.

Entries.Name: max_recv_msg_size
Entries.FieldDesc: gRPC client max receive message size (bytes).

Entries.Name: max_send_msg_size
Entries.FieldDesc: gRPC client max send message size (bytes).

Entries.Name: grpc_compression
Entries.FieldDesc: Use compression when sending messages. Supported values are: gzip, snappy, ''

Entries.Name: rate_limit
Entries.FieldDesc: Rate limit for gRPC client; 0 means disabled.

Entries.Name: rate_limit_burst
Entries.FieldDesc: Rate limit burst for gRPC client.

Entries.Name: backoff_on_ratelimits
Entries.FieldDesc: Enable backoff and retry when we hit rate limits.

Entries.Name: min_period
Entries.FieldDesc: Minimum delay when backing off.

Entries.Name: max_period
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum delay when backing off.

Entries.Name: max_retries
Entries.FieldDesc: Number of times to backoff and retry before failing.

Entries.Name: initial_stream_window_size
Entries.FieldDesc: Initial stream window size. Values less than the default are not supported and are ignored. Setting this to a value other than the default disables the BDP estimator.

Entries.Name: initial_connection_window_size
Entries.FieldDesc: Initial connection window size. Values less than the default are not supported and are ignored. Setting this to a value other than the default disables the BDP estimator.

Entries.Name: tls_enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: Enable TLS in the gRPC client. This flag needs to be enabled when any other TLS flag is set. If set to false, insecure connection to gRPC server will be used.

Block.Name: tls_config

Entries.FieldDesc: Path to the CA certificates to validate server certificate against. If not set, the host's root CA certificates are used.

Entries.Name: connect_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: The maximum amount of time to establish a connection. A value of 0 means default gRPC client connect timeout and backoff.

Entries.Name: connect_backoff_base_delay
Entries.FieldDesc: Initial backoff delay after first connection failure. Only relevant if ConnectTimeout > 0.

Entries.Name: connect_backoff_max_delay
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum backoff delay when establishing a connection. Only relevant if ConnectTimeout > 0.

Entries.Name: label
Entries.FieldDesc: Optionally define the cluster validation label.

Entries.Name: graceful_shutdown_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: Time to wait for inflight requests to finish before forcefully shutting down. This needs to be aligned with the query timeout and the graceful termination period of the process orchestrator.

Entries.Name: instance_interface_names
Entries.FieldDesc: Name of network interface to read address from. This address is sent to query-scheduler and querier, which uses it to send the query response back to query-frontend.

Entries.Name: instance_enable_ipv6
Entries.FieldDesc: Enable using a IPv6 instance address (default false).

Entries.Name: encoding
Entries.FieldDesc: Defines the encoding for requests to and responses from the scheduler and querier. Can be 'json' or 'protobuf' (defaults to 'json').

Entries.Name: compress_responses
Entries.FieldDesc: Compress HTTP responses.

Entries.Name: downstream_url
Entries.FieldDesc: URL of downstream Loki.

Block.Name: cache_config
Block.Desc: The cache_config block configures the cache backend for a specific Loki component.

Entries.Name: default_validity
Entries.FieldDesc: The default validity of entries for caches unless overridden.

Entries.Name: writeback_goroutines
Entries.FieldDesc: At what concurrency to write back to cache.

Entries.Name: writeback_buffer
Entries.FieldDesc: How many key batches to buffer for background write-back. Default is large to prefer size based limiting.

Entries.Name: writeback_size_limit
Entries.FieldDesc: Size limit in bytes for background write-back.

Entries.Name: expiration
Entries.FieldDesc: How long keys stay in the memcache.

Entries.Name: batch_size
Entries.FieldDesc: How many keys to fetch in each batch.

Entries.Name: parallelism
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum active requests to memcache.

Entries.Name: host
Entries.FieldDesc: Hostname for memcached service to use. If empty and if addresses is unset, no memcached will be used.

Entries.Name: service
Entries.FieldDesc: SRV service used to discover memcache servers.

Entries.Name: addresses
Entries.FieldDesc: Comma separated addresses list in DNS Service Discovery format: https://grafana.com/docs/mimir/latest/configure/about-dns-service-discovery/#supported-discovery-modes

Entries.Name: timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum time to wait before giving up on memcached requests.

Entries.Name: max_idle_conns
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum number of idle connections in pool.

Entries.Name: max_item_size
Entries.FieldDesc: The maximum size of an item stored in memcached. Bigger items are not stored. If set to 0, no maximum size is enforced.

Entries.Name: update_interval
Entries.FieldDesc: Period with which to poll DNS for memcache servers.

Entries.Name: consistent_hash
Entries.FieldDesc: Use consistent hashing to distribute to memcache servers.

Entries.Name: circuit_breaker_consecutive_failures
Entries.FieldDesc: Trip circuit-breaker after this number of consecutive dial failures (if zero then circuit-breaker is disabled).

Entries.Name: circuit_breaker_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: Duration circuit-breaker remains open after tripping (if zero then 60 seconds is used).

Entries.Name: circuit_breaker_interval
Entries.FieldDesc: Reset circuit-breaker counts after this long (if zero then never reset).

Entries.FieldDesc: Enable connecting to Memcached with TLS.

Entries.Name: endpoint
Entries.FieldDesc: Redis Server or Cluster configuration endpoint to use for caching. A comma-separated list of endpoints for Redis Cluster or Redis Sentinel. If empty, no redis will be used.

Entries.Name: master_name
Entries.FieldDesc: Redis Sentinel master name. An empty string for Redis Server or Redis Cluster.

Entries.Name: timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum time to wait before giving up on redis requests.

Entries.Name: expiration
Entries.FieldDesc: How long keys stay in the redis.

Entries.Name: db
Entries.FieldDesc: Database index.

Entries.Name: pool_size
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum number of connections in the pool.

Entries.Name: username
Entries.FieldDesc: Username to use when connecting to redis.

Entries.Name: password
Entries.FieldDesc: Password to use when connecting to redis.

Entries.Name: tls_enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: Enable connecting to redis with TLS.

Entries.Name: tls_insecure_skip_verify
Entries.FieldDesc: Skip validating server certificate.

Entries.Name: idle_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: Close connections after remaining idle for this duration. If the value is zero, then idle connections are not closed.

Entries.Name: max_connection_age
Entries.FieldDesc: Close connections older than this duration. If the value is zero, then the pool does not close connections based on age.

Entries.Name: route_randomly
Entries.FieldDesc: By default, the Redis client only reads from the master node. Enabling this option can lower pressure on the master node by randomly routing read-only commands to the master and any available replicas.

Entries.Name: enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: Whether embedded cache is enabled.

Entries.Name: max_size_mb
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum memory size of the cache in MB.

Entries.Name: max_size_items
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum number of entries in the cache.

Entries.Name: ttl
Entries.FieldDesc: The time to live for items in the cache before they get purged.

Entries.BlockDesc: The cache_config block configures the cache backend for a specific Loki component.

Entries.Name: compression
Entries.FieldDesc: Use compression in cache. The default is an empty value '', which disables compression. Supported values are: 'snappy' and ''.

Entries.Name: cache_results
Entries.FieldDesc: Cache query results.

Entries.Name: max_retries
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum number of retries for a single request; beyond this, the downstream error is returned.

Entries.Name: parallelise_shardable_queries
Entries.FieldDesc: Perform query parallelisations based on storage sharding configuration and query ASTs. This feature is supported only by the chunks storage engine.

Entries.Name: shard_aggregations
Entries.FieldDesc: A comma-separated list of LogQL vector and range aggregations that should be sharded. Possible values 'quantile_over_time', 'last_over_time', 'first_over_time'.

Entries.Name: cache_index_stats_results
Entries.FieldDesc: Cache index stats query results.

Entries.FieldDesc: Close connections after remaining idle for this duration. If the value is zero, then idle connections are not closed.

Entries.Name: max_connection_age
Entries.FieldDesc: Close connections older than this duration. If the value is zero, then the pool does not close connections based on age.

Entries.FieldDesc: By default, the Redis client only reads from the master node. Enabling this option can lower pressure on the master node by randomly routing read-only commands to the master and any available replicas.

Entries.Name: cas_retry_delay
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum duration to wait before retrying a Compare And Swap (CAS) operation.

Entries.Name: secondary
Entries.FieldDesc: Secondary backend storage used by multi-client.

Entries.Name: mirror_enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: Mirror writes to secondary store.

Entries.Name: mirror_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: Timeout for storing value to secondary store.

Entries.Name: heartbeat_period
Entries.FieldDesc: Interval between heartbeats sent to the ring. 0 = disabled.

Entries.Name: heartbeat_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: The heartbeat timeout after which ruler ring members are considered unhealthy within the ring. 0 = never (timeout disabled).

Entries.Name: instance_interface_names
Entries.FieldDesc: Name of network interface to read addresses from.

Entries.Name: num_tokens
Entries.FieldDesc: The number of tokens the lifecycler will generate and put into the ring if it joined without transferring tokens from another lifecycler.

Entries.BlockDesc: Ring used by Loki ruler. The CLI flags prefix for this block configuration is 'ruler.ring'.

Entries.Name: flush_period
Entries.FieldDesc: Period with which to attempt to flush rule groups.

Entries.Name: enable_api
Entries.FieldDesc: Enable the ruler API.

Entries.Name: enabled_tenants
Entries.FieldDesc: Comma separated list of tenants whose rules this ruler can evaluate. If specified, only these tenants will be handled by ruler, otherwise this ruler can process rules from all tenants. Subject to sharding.

Entries.Name: disabled_tenants
Entries.FieldDesc: Comma separated list of tenants whose rules this ruler cannot evaluate. If specified, a ruler that would normally pick the specified tenant(s) for processing will ignore them instead. Subject to sharding.

Entries.Name: query_stats_enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: Report the wall time for ruler queries to complete as a per user metric and as an info level log message.

Entries.Name: disable_rule_group_label
Entries.FieldDesc: Disable the rule_group label on exported metrics.

Entries.Name: dir
Entries.FieldDesc: The directory in which to write tenant WAL files. Each tenant will have its own directory one level below this directory.

Entries.Name: truncate_frequency

Entries.Name: min_age
Entries.FieldDesc: Minimum age that samples must exist in the WAL before being truncated.

Entries.Name: max_age
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum age that samples must exist in the WAL before being truncated.

Entries.Name: min_age
Entries.FieldDesc: The minimum age of a WAL to consider for cleaning.

Entries.Name: period
Entries.FieldDesc: How often to run the WAL cleaner. 0 = disabled.

If specified, it will be dropped during config parsing.

Entries.FieldDesc: The evaluation mode for the ruler. Can be either 'local' or 'remote'. If set to 'local', the ruler will evaluate rules locally. If set to 'remote', the ruler will evaluate rules remotely. If unset, the ruler will evaluate rules locally.

Entries.Name: max_jitter
Entries.FieldDesc: Upper bound of random duration to wait before rule evaluation to avoid contention during concurrent execution of rules. Jitter is calculated consistently for a given rule. Set 0 to disable (default).

Entries.FieldDesc: GRPC listen address of the query-frontend(s). Must be a DNS address (prefixed with dns:///) to enable client side load balancing.

Block.Name: thanos_object_store_config
Block.Desc:
The thanos_object_store_config block configures the connection to object storage backend using thanos-io/objstore clients. This will become the default way of configuring object store clients in future releases.
Currently this is opt-in and takes effect only when `-use-thanos-objstore` is set to true.

Entries.Name: endpoint
Entries.FieldDesc: The S3 bucket endpoint. It could be an AWS S3 endpoint listed at https://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/s3.html or the address of an S3-compatible service in hostname:port format.

Entries.Name: region
Entries.FieldDesc: S3 region. If unset, the client will issue a S3 GetBucketLocation API call to autodetect it.

Entries.Name: bucket_name
Entries.FieldDesc: S3 bucket name

Entries.Name: secret_access_key
Entries.FieldDesc: S3 secret access key

Entries.Name: access_key_id
Entries.FieldDesc: S3 access key ID

Entries.Name: session_token
Entries.FieldDesc: S3 session token

Entries.Name: insecure
Entries.FieldDesc: If enabled, use http:// for the S3 endpoint instead of https://. This could be useful in local dev/test environments while using an S3-compatible backend storage, like Minio.

Entries.Name: list_objects_version
Entries.FieldDesc: Use a specific version of the S3 list object API. Supported values are v1 or v2. Default is unset.

Entries.Name: bucket_lookup_type
Entries.FieldDesc: Bucket lookup style type, used to access bucket in S3-compatible service. Default is auto. Supported values are: auto, path, virtual-hosted.

Entries.Name: dualstack_enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: When enabled, direct all AWS S3 requests to the dual-stack IPv4/IPv6 endpoint for the configured region.

Entries.Name: storage_class
Entries.FieldDesc: The S3 storage class to use, not set by default. Details can be found at https://aws.amazon.com/s3/storage-classes/. Supported values are: STANDARD, REDUCED_REDUNDANCY, GLACIER, STANDARD_IA, ONEZONE_IA, INTELLIGENT_TIERING, DEEP_ARCHIVE, OUTPOSTS, GLACIER_IR, SNOW, EXPRESS_ONEZONE

Entries.Name: native_aws_auth_enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: If enabled, it will use the default authentication methods of the AWS SDK for go based on known environment variables and known AWS config files.

Entries.Name: part_size
Entries.FieldDesc: The minimum file size in bytes used for multipart uploads. If 0, the value is optimally computed for each object.

Entries.Name: send_content_md5
Entries.FieldDesc: If enabled, a Content-MD5 header is sent with S3 Put Object requests. Consumes more resources to compute the MD5, but may improve compatibility with object storage services that do not support checksums.

Entries.Name: sts_endpoint
Entries.FieldDesc: Accessing S3 resources using temporary, secure credentials provided by AWS Security Token Service.

Entries.Name: max_retries
Entries.FieldDesc: The maximum number of retries for S3 requests that are retryable. Default is 10, set this to 1 to disable retries.

Entries.Name: type
Entries.FieldDesc: Enable AWS Server Side Encryption. Supported values: SSE-KMS, SSE-S3.

Entries.Name: kms_key_id
Entries.FieldDesc: KMS Key ID used to encrypt objects in S3

Entries.Name: kms_encryption_context
Entries.FieldDesc: KMS Encryption Context used for object encryption. It expects JSON formatted string.

Entries.Name: idle_conn_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: The time an idle connection will remain idle before closing.

Entries.Name: response_header_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: The amount of time the client will wait for a servers response headers.

Entries.Name: insecure_skip_verify
Entries.FieldDesc: If the client connects via HTTPS and this option is enabled, the client will accept any certificate and hostname.

Entries.Name: tls_handshake_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum time to wait for a TLS handshake. 0 means no limit.

Entries.Name: expect_continue_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: The time to wait for a server's first response headers after fully writing the request headers if the request has an Expect header. 0 to send the request body immediately.

Entries.Name: max_idle_connections
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum number of idle (keep-alive) connections across all hosts. 0 means no limit.

Entries.Name: max_idle_connections_per_host
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum number of idle (keep-alive) connections to keep per-host. If 0, a built-in default value is used.

Entries.Name: max_connections_per_host
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum number of connections per host. 0 means no limit.

Entries.Name: tls_ca_path
Entries.FieldDesc: Path to the CA certificates to validate server certificate against. If not set, the host's root CA certificates are used.

Entries.Name: tls_cert_path
Entries.FieldDesc: Path to the client certificate, which will be used for authenticating with the server. Also requires the key path to be configured.

Entries.Name: tls_key_path
Entries.FieldDesc: Path to the key for the client certificate. Also requires the client certificate to be configured.

Entries.Name: tls_server_name
Entries.FieldDesc: Override the expected name on the server certificate.

Entries.Name: enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: When enabled, low-level S3 HTTP operation information is logged at the debug level.

Entries.Name: bucket_name
Entries.FieldDesc: GCS bucket name

Entries.Name: service_account
Entries.FieldDesc:
JSON either from a Google Developers Console client_credentials.json file, or a Google Developers service account key. Needs to be valid JSON, not a filesystem path. If empty, fallback to Google default logic:
1. A JSON file whose path is specified by the GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIALS environment variable. For workload identity federation, refer to https://cloud.google.com/iam/docs/how-to#using-workload-identity-federation on how to generate the JSON configuration file for on-prem/non-Google cloud platforms.
2. A JSON file in a location known to the gcloud command-line tool: $HOME/.config/gcloud/application_default_credentials.json.
3. On Google Compute Engine it fetches credentials from the metadata server.

Entries.Name: chunk_buffer_size
Entries.FieldDesc: The maximum size of the buffer that GCS client for a single PUT request. 0 to disable buffering.

Entries.Name: max_retries
Entries.FieldDesc: The maximum number of retries for idempotent operations. Overrides the default gcs storage client behavior if this value is greater than 0. Set this to 1 to disable retries.

Entries.Name: account_name
Entries.FieldDesc: Azure storage account name

Entries.Name: account_key
Entries.FieldDesc: Azure storage account key. If unset, Azure managed identities will be used for authentication instead.

Entries.Name: connection_string
Entries.FieldDesc: If `connection-string` is set, the value of `endpoint-suffix` will not be used. Use this method over `account-key` if you need to authenticate via a SAS token. Or if you use the Azurite emulator.

Entries.Name: container_name
Entries.FieldDesc: Azure storage container name

Entries.Name: endpoint_suffix
Entries.FieldDesc: Azure storage endpoint suffix without schema. The account name will be prefixed to this value to create the FQDN. If set to empty string, default endpoint suffix is used.

Entries.Name: max_retries
Entries.FieldDesc: Number of retries for recoverable errors

Entries.Name: user_assigned_id
Entries.FieldDesc: User assigned managed identity. If empty, then System assigned identity is used.

Entries.Name: chunk_delimiter
Entries.FieldDesc: Delimiter used to replace ':' in chunk IDs when storing chunks

Entries.Name: application_credential_id
Entries.FieldDesc: OpenStack Swift application credential id

Entries.Name: application_credential_name
Entries.FieldDesc: OpenStack Swift application credential name

Entries.Name: application_credential_secret
Entries.FieldDesc: OpenStack Swift application credential secret

Entries.Name: auth_version
Entries.FieldDesc: OpenStack Swift authentication API version. 0 to autodetect.

Entries.Name: auth_url
Entries.FieldDesc: OpenStack Swift authentication URL

Entries.Name: username
Entries.FieldDesc: OpenStack Swift username.

Entries.Name: user_domain_name
Entries.FieldDesc: OpenStack Swift user's domain name.

Entries.Name: user_domain_id
Entries.FieldDesc: OpenStack Swift user's domain ID.

Entries.Name: user_id
Entries.FieldDesc: OpenStack Swift user ID.

Entries.Name: password
Entries.FieldDesc: OpenStack Swift API key.

Entries.Name: domain_id
Entries.FieldDesc: OpenStack Swift user's domain ID.

Entries.Name: domain_name
Entries.FieldDesc: OpenStack Swift user's domain name.

Entries.Name: project_id
Entries.FieldDesc: OpenStack Swift project ID (v2,v3 auth only).

Entries.Name: project_name
Entries.FieldDesc: OpenStack Swift project name (v2,v3 auth only).

Entries.Name: project_domain_id
Entries.FieldDesc: ID of the OpenStack Swift project's domain (v3 auth only), only needed if it differs the from user domain.

Entries.Name: project_domain_name
Entries.FieldDesc: Name of the OpenStack Swift project's domain (v3 auth only), only needed if it differs from the user domain.

Entries.Name: region_name
Entries.FieldDesc: OpenStack Swift Region to use (v2,v3 auth only).

Entries.Name: container_name
Entries.FieldDesc: Name of the OpenStack Swift container to put chunks in.

Entries.Name: max_retries
Entries.FieldDesc: Max retries on requests error.

Entries.Name: connect_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: Time after which a connection attempt is aborted.

Entries.Name: request_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: Time after which an idle request is aborted. The timeout watchdog is reset each time some data is received, so the timeout triggers after X time no data is received on a request.

Entries.Name: idle_conn_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: The time an idle connection will remain idle before closing.

Entries.Name: response_header_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: The amount of time the client will wait for a servers response headers.

Entries.Name: insecure_skip_verify
Entries.FieldDesc: If the client connects via HTTPS and this option is enabled, the client will accept any certificate and hostname.

Entries.Name: tls_handshake_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum time to wait for a TLS handshake. 0 means no limit.

Entries.Name: expect_continue_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: The time to wait for a server's first response headers after fully writing the request headers if the request has an Expect header. 0 to send the request body immediately.

Entries.Name: max_idle_connections
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum number of idle (keep-alive) connections across all hosts. 0 means no limit.

Entries.Name: max_idle_connections_per_host
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum number of idle (keep-alive) connections to keep per-host. If 0, a built-in default value is used.

Entries.Name: max_connections_per_host
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum number of connections per host. 0 means no limit.

Entries.Name: tls_ca_path
Entries.FieldDesc: Path to the CA certificates to validate server certificate against. If not set, the host's root CA certificates are used.

Entries.Name: tls_cert_path
Entries.FieldDesc: Path to the client certificate, which will be used for authenticating with the server. Also requires the key path to be configured.

Entries.Name: tls_key_path
Entries.FieldDesc: Path to the key for the client certificate. Also requires the client certificate to be configured.

Entries.Name: tls_server_name
Entries.FieldDesc: Override the expected name on the server certificate.

Entries.Name: dir
Entries.FieldDesc: Local filesystem storage directory.

Entries.Name: endpoint
Entries.FieldDesc: Endpoint to connect to.

Entries.Name: bucket
Entries.FieldDesc: Name of OSS bucket.

Entries.Name: access_key_id
Entries.FieldDesc: alibabacloud Access Key ID

Entries.Name: access_key_secret
Entries.FieldDesc: alibabacloud Secret Access Key

Entries.Name: bucket
Entries.FieldDesc: Name of BOS bucket.

Entries.Name: endpoint
Entries.FieldDesc: BOS endpoint to connect to.

Entries.Name: access_key
Entries.FieldDesc: Baidu Cloud Engine (BCE) Access Key ID.

Entries.Name: secret_key
Entries.FieldDesc: Baidu Cloud Engine (BCE) Secret Access Key.

Entries.Name: storage_prefix
Entries.FieldDesc: Prefix for all objects stored in the backend storage. For simplicity, it may only contain digits, English alphabet letters and dashes.

Entries.Name: remote_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: How quickly a dead client will be removed after it has been detected to disappear. Set this to a value to allow time for a secondary health check to recover the missing client.

Entries.Name: initial_connection_window_size
Entries.FieldDesc: Initial connection window size. Values less than the default are not supported and are ignored. Setting this to a value other than the default disables the BDP estimator.

Entries.Name: connect_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: The maximum amount of time to establish a connection. A value of 0 means default gRPC client connect timeout and backoff.

Entries.Name: connect_backoff_base_delay
Entries.FieldDesc: Initial backoff delay after first connection failure. Only relevant if ConnectTimeout > 0.

Entries.Name: connect_backoff_max_delay
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum backoff delay when establishing a connection. Only relevant if ConnectTimeout > 0.

Entries.Name: label
Entries.FieldDesc: Optionally define the cluster validation label.

Entries.BlockDesc: Configures how the gRPC connection to ingesters work as a client.
The ingester_client block configures how the distributor will connect to ingesters. Only appropriate when running all components, the distributor, or the querier.

Entries.Name: ingester

Block.Name: ingester
Block.Desc: The ingester block configures the ingester and how the ingester will register itself to a key value store.

Entries.Name: lifecycler

Block.Name: lifecycler
Block.Desc: Configures how the lifecycle of the ingester will operate and where it will register for discovery.

Entries.Name: store
Entries.FieldDesc: Backend storage to use for the ring. Supported values are: consul, etcd, inmemory, memberlist, multi.

Entries.Name: prefix
Entries.FieldDesc: The prefix for the keys in the store. Should end with a /.

Entries.Name: consul

Block.Name: consul
Block.Desc: Configuration for a Consul client. Only applies if the selected kvstore is consul.

Entries.Name: host
Entries.FieldDesc: Hostname and port of Consul.

Entries.Name: acl_token
Entries.FieldDesc: ACL Token used to interact with Consul.

Entries.Name: http_client_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: HTTP timeout when talking to Consul

Entries.Name: consistent_reads
Entries.FieldDesc: Enable consistent reads to Consul.

Entries.Name: watch_rate_limit
Entries.FieldDesc: Rate limit when watching key or prefix in Consul, in requests per second. 0 disables the rate limit.

Entries.Name: watch_burst_size
Entries.FieldDesc: Burst size used in rate limit. Values less than 1 are treated as 1.

Entries.Name: cas_retry_delay
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum duration to wait before retrying a Compare And Swap (CAS) operation.

Entries.BlockDesc: Configuration for a Consul client. Only applies if the selected kvstore is consul.

Entries.Name: etcd

Block.Name: etcd
Block.Desc: Configuration for an ETCD v3 client. Only applies if the selected kvstore is etcd.

Entries.Name: endpoints
Entries.FieldDesc: The etcd endpoints to connect to.

Entries.Name: dial_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: The dial timeout for the etcd connection.

Entries.Name: max_retries
Entries.FieldDesc: The maximum number of retries to do for failed ops.

Entries.Name: tls_enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: Enable TLS.

Block.Name: tls_config
Block.Desc: The TLS configuration.

Entries.Name: tls_cert_path
Entries.FieldDesc: Path to the client certificate, which will be used for authenticating with the server. Also requires the key path to be configured.

Entries.Name: tls_key_path
Entries.FieldDesc: Path to the key for the client certificate. Also requires the client certificate to be configured.

Entries.Name: tls_ca_path
Entries.FieldDesc: Path to the CA certificates to validate server certificate against. If not set, the host's root CA certificates are used.

Entries.Name: tls_server_name
Entries.FieldDesc: Override the expected name on the server certificate.

Entries.Name: tls_insecure_skip_verify
Entries.FieldDesc: Skip validating server certificate.

Entries.Name: tls_cipher_suites
Entries.FieldDesc:
Override the default cipher suite list (separated by commas). Allowed values:

Secure Ciphers:
- TLS_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
- TLS_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
- TLS_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256

Insecure Ciphers:
- TLS_RSA_WITH_RC4_128_SHA
- TLS_RSA_WITH_3DES_EDE_CBC_SHA
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_RC4_128_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_RC4_128_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_3DES_EDE_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256

Entries.Name: tls_min_version
Entries.FieldDesc: Override the default minimum TLS version. Allowed values: VersionTLS10, VersionTLS11, VersionTLS12, VersionTLS13

Entries.BlockDesc: The TLS configuration.

Entries.Name: username
Entries.FieldDesc: Etcd username.

Entries.Name: password
Entries.FieldDesc: Etcd password.

Entries.BlockDesc: Configuration for an ETCD v3 client. Only applies if the selected kvstore is etcd.

Entries.Name: primary
Entries.FieldDesc: Primary backend storage used by multi-client.

Entries.Name: secondary
Entries.FieldDesc: Secondary backend storage used by multi-client.

Entries.Name: mirror_enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: Mirror writes to secondary store.

Entries.Name: mirror_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: Timeout for storing value to secondary store.

Entries.Name: heartbeat_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: The heartbeat timeout after which ingesters are skipped for reads/writes. 0 = never (timeout disabled).

Entries.Name: replication_factor
Entries.FieldDesc: The number of ingesters to write to and read from.

Entries.Name: zone_awareness_enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: True to enable the zone-awareness and replicate ingested samples across different availability zones.

Entries.Name: excluded_zones
Entries.FieldDesc: Comma-separated list of zones to exclude from the ring. Instances in excluded zones will be filtered out from the ring.

Entries.Name: num_tokens
Entries.FieldDesc: Number of tokens for each ingester.

Entries.Name: heartbeat_period
Entries.FieldDesc: Period at which to heartbeat to consul. 0 = disabled.

Entries.Name: heartbeat_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: Heartbeat timeout after which instance is assumed to be unhealthy. 0 = disabled.

Entries.Name: observe_period
Entries.FieldDesc: Observe tokens after generating to resolve collisions. Useful when using gossiping ring.

Entries.Name: join_after
Entries.FieldDesc: Period to wait for a claim from another member; will join automatically after this.

Entries.Name: min_ready_duration
Entries.FieldDesc: Minimum duration to wait after the internal readiness checks have passed but before succeeding the readiness endpoint. This is used to slowdown deployment controllers (eg. Kubernetes) after an instance is ready and before they proceed with a rolling update, to give the rest of the cluster instances enough time to receive ring updates.

Entries.Name: interface_names
Entries.FieldDesc: Name of network interface to read address from.

Entries.Name: enable_inet6
Entries.FieldDesc: Enable IPv6 support. Required to make use of IP addresses from IPv6 interfaces.

Entries.Name: final_sleep
Entries.FieldDesc: Duration to sleep for before exiting, to ensure metrics are scraped.

Entries.Name: tokens_file_path
Entries.FieldDesc: File path where tokens are stored. If empty, tokens are not stored at shutdown and restored at startup.

Entries.Name: availability_zone
Entries.FieldDesc: The availability zone where this instance is running.

Entries.Name: unregister_on_shutdown
Entries.FieldDesc: Unregister from the ring upon clean shutdown. It can be useful to disable for rolling restarts with consistent naming in conjunction with -distributor.extend-writes=false.

Entries.Name: readiness_check_ring_health
Entries.FieldDesc: When enabled the readiness probe succeeds only after all instances are ACTIVE and healthy in the ring, otherwise only the instance itself is checked. This option should be disabled if in your cluster multiple instances can be rolled out simultaneously, otherwise rolling updates may be slowed down.

Entries.Name: address
Entries.FieldDesc: IP address to advertise in the ring.

Entries.Name: port
Entries.FieldDesc: port to advertise in consul (defaults to server.grpc-listen-port).

Entries.Name: id
Entries.FieldDesc: ID to register in the ring.

Entries.BlockDesc: Configures how the lifecycle of the ingester will operate and where it will register for discovery.

Entries.Name: concurrent_flushes
Entries.FieldDesc: How many flushes can happen concurrently from each stream.

Entries.Name: flush_check_period
Entries.FieldDesc: How often should the ingester see if there are any blocks to flush. The first flush check is delayed by a random time up to 0.8x the flush check period. Additionally, there is +/- 1% jitter added to the interval.

Entries.Name: min_period
Entries.FieldDesc: Minimum backoff period when a flush fails. Each concurrent flush has its own backoff, see `ingester.concurrent-flushes`.

Entries.Name: max_period
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum backoff period when a flush fails. Each concurrent flush has its own backoff, see `ingester.concurrent-flushes`.

Entries.Name: max_retries
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum retries for failed flushes.

Entries.Name: flush_op_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: The timeout for an individual flush. Will be retried up to `flush-op-backoff-retries` times.

Entries.Name: chunk_retain_period
Entries.FieldDesc: How long chunks should be retained in-memory after they've been flushed.

Entries.Name: chunk_idle_period
Entries.FieldDesc: How long chunks should sit in-memory with no updates before being flushed if they don't hit the max block size. This means that half-empty chunks will still be flushed after a certain period as long as they receive no further activity.

Entries.Name: chunk_block_size
Entries.FieldDesc: The targeted _uncompressed_ size in bytes of a chunk block When this threshold is exceeded the head block will be cut and compressed inside the chunk.

Entries.Name: chunk_target_size
Entries.FieldDesc: A target _compressed_ size in bytes for chunks. This is a desired size not an exact size, chunks may be slightly bigger or significantly smaller if they get flushed for other reasons (e.g. chunk_idle_period). A value of 0 creates chunks with a fixed 10 blocks, a non zero value will create chunks with a variable number of blocks to meet the target size.

Entries.Name: chunk_encoding
Entries.FieldDesc: The algorithm to use for compressing chunk. (none, gzip, lz4-64k, snappy, lz4-256k, lz4-1M, lz4, flate, zstd)

Entries.Name: max_chunk_age
Entries.FieldDesc: The maximum duration of a timeseries chunk in memory. If a timeseries runs for longer than this, the current chunk will be flushed to the store and a new chunk created.

Entries.Name: autoforget_unhealthy
Entries.FieldDesc: Forget about ingesters having heartbeat timestamps older than `ring.kvstore.heartbeat_timeout`. This is equivalent to clicking on the `/ring` `forget` button in the UI: the ingester is removed from the ring. This is a useful setting when you are sure that an unhealthy node won't return. An example is when not using stateful sets or the equivalent. Use `memberlist.rejoin_interval` > 0 to handle network partition cases when using a memberlist.

Entries.Name: sync_period
Entries.FieldDesc: Parameters used to synchronize ingesters to cut chunks at the same moment. Sync period is used to roll over incoming entry to a new chunk. If chunk's utilization isn't high enough (eg. less than 50% when sync_min_utilization is set to 0.5), then this chunk rollover doesn't happen.

Entries.Name: sync_min_utilization
Entries.FieldDesc: Minimum utilization of chunk when doing synchronization.

Entries.Name: max_returned_stream_errors
Entries.FieldDesc: The maximum number of errors a stream will report to the user when a push fails. 0 to make unlimited.

Entries.Name: query_store_max_look_back_period
Entries.FieldDesc: How far back should an ingester be allowed to query the store for data, for use only with boltdb-shipper/tsdb index and filesystem object store. -1 for infinite.

Entries.Name: wal

Block.Name: wal
Block.Desc: The ingester WAL (Write Ahead Log) records incoming logs and stores them on the local file systems in order to guarantee persistence of acknowledged data in the event of a process crash.

Entries.Name: enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: Enable writing of ingested data into WAL.

Entries.Name: dir
Entries.FieldDesc: Directory where the WAL data is stored and/or recovered from.

Entries.Name: checkpoint_duration
Entries.FieldDesc: Interval at which checkpoints should be created.

Entries.Name: flush_on_shutdown
Entries.FieldDesc: When WAL is enabled, should chunks be flushed to long-term storage on shutdown.

Entries.Name: replay_memory_ceiling
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum memory size the WAL may use during replay. After hitting this, it will flush data to storage before continuing. A unit suffix (KB, MB, GB) may be applied.

Entries.BlockDesc: The ingester WAL (Write Ahead Log) records incoming logs and stores them on the local file systems in order to guarantee persistence of acknowledged data in the event of a process crash.

Entries.Name: index_shards
Entries.FieldDesc: Shard factor used in the ingesters for the in process reverse index. This MUST be evenly divisible by ALL schema shard factors or Loki will not start.

Entries.Name: max_dropped_streams
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum number of dropped streams to keep in memory during tailing.

Entries.Name: shutdown_marker_path
Entries.FieldDesc: Path where the shutdown marker file is stored. If not set and common.path_prefix is set then common.path_prefix will be used.

Entries.Name: owned_streams_check_interval
Entries.FieldDesc: Interval at which the ingester ownedStreamService checks for changes in the ring to recalculate owned streams.

Entries.Name: enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: Whether the kafka ingester is enabled.

Entries.Name: kvstore

Block.Name: kvstore
Block.Desc: The key-value store used to share the hash ring across multiple instances. This option needs be set on ingesters, distributors, queriers, and rulers when running in microservices mode.

Entries.FieldDesc: Backend storage to use for the ring. Supported values are: consul, etcd, inmemory, memberlist, multi.

Entries.Name: prefix
Entries.FieldDesc: The prefix for the keys in the store. Should end with a /.

Entries.Name: min_partition_owners_count
Entries.FieldDesc: Minimum number of owners to wait before a PENDING partition gets switched to ACTIVE.

Entries.Name: min_partition_owners_duration
Entries.FieldDesc: How long the minimum number of owners are enforced before a PENDING partition gets switched to ACTIVE.

Entries.Name: delete_inactive_partition_after
Entries.FieldDesc: How long to wait before an INACTIVE partition is eligible for deletion. The partition is deleted only if it has been in INACTIVE state for at least the configured duration and it has no owners registered. A value of 0 disables partitions deletion.

Entries.BlockDesc: The ingester block configures the ingester and how the ingester will register itself to a key value store.

This is a desired size not an exact size, chunks may be slightly bigger or significantly smaller if they get flushed for other reasons (e.g. chunk_idle_period). Entries.Name: worker_parallelism

Entries.Name: sync_interval
Entries.FieldDesc: The interval at which to sync job status with the scheduler.

Entries.Name: poll_interval
Entries.FieldDesc: The interval at which to poll for new jobs.

Entries.Name: scheduler_address
Entries.FieldDesc: Address of the scheduler in the format described here: https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/master/doc/naming.md

Entries.Name: scheduler_grpc_client_config

Block.Name: grpc_client
Block.Desc: The grpc_client block configures the gRPC client used to communicate between a client and server component in Loki.

Entries.Name: max_recv_msg_size
Entries.FieldDesc: gRPC client max receive message size (bytes).

Entries.Name: max_send_msg_size
Entries.FieldDesc: gRPC client max send message size (bytes).

Entries.Name: grpc_compression
Entries.FieldDesc: Use compression when sending messages. Supported values are: gzip, snappy, ''

Entries.Name: rate_limit
Entries.FieldDesc: Rate limit for gRPC client; 0 means disabled.

Entries.Name: rate_limit_burst
Entries.FieldDesc: Rate limit burst for gRPC client.

Entries.Name: backoff_on_ratelimits
Entries.FieldDesc: Enable backoff and retry when we hit rate limits.

Entries.Name: min_period
Entries.FieldDesc: Minimum delay when backing off.

Entries.Name: max_period
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum delay when backing off.

Entries.Name: max_retries
Entries.FieldDesc: Number of times to backoff and retry before failing.

Entries.Name: initial_stream_window_size
Entries.FieldDesc: Initial stream window size. Values less than the default are not supported and are ignored. Setting this to a value other than the default disables the BDP estimator.

Entries.Name: initial_connection_window_size
Entries.FieldDesc: Initial connection window size. Values less than the default are not supported and are ignored. Setting this to a value other than the default disables the BDP estimator.

Entries.Name: tls_enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: Enable TLS in the gRPC client. This flag needs to be enabled when any other TLS flag is set. If set to false, insecure connection to gRPC server will be used.

Entries.FieldDesc: Lookback period used by the scheduler to plan jobs when the consumer group has no commits. 0 consumes from the start of the partition.

Entries.Name: strategy
Entries.FieldDesc: Strategy used by the planner to plan jobs. One of record-count

Entries.FieldDesc: Target record count used by the planner to plan jobs. Only used when strategy is record-count

Entries.FieldDesc: Interval to check for expired job leases

Entries.Name: lease_duration
Entries.FieldDesc: Duration after which a job lease is considered expired if the scheduler receives no updates from builders about the job. Expired jobs are re-enqueued

Entries.FieldDesc: Mirror writes to secondary store.

Entries.FieldDesc: Timeout for storing value to secondary store.

Entries.Name: heartbeat_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: The heartbeat timeout after which ingesters are skipped for reads/writes. 0 = never (timeout disabled).

Entries.Name: replication_factor
Entries.FieldDesc: The number of ingesters to write to and read from.

Entries.Name: zone_awareness_enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: True to enable the zone-awareness and replicate ingested samples across different availability zones.

Entries.Name: excluded_zones
Entries.FieldDesc: Comma-separated list of zones to exclude from the ring. Instances in excluded zones will be filtered out from the ring.

Entries.Name: num_tokens
Entries.FieldDesc: Number of tokens for each ingester.

Entries.Name: heartbeat_period
Entries.FieldDesc: Period at which to heartbeat to consul. 0 = disabled.

Entries.Name: heartbeat_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: Heartbeat timeout after which instance is assumed to be unhealthy. 0 = disabled.

Entries.Name: observe_period
Entries.FieldDesc: Observe tokens after generating to resolve collisions. Useful when using gossiping ring.

Entries.Name: join_after
Entries.FieldDesc: Period to wait for a claim from another member; will join automatically after this.

Entries.Name: min_ready_duration
Entries.FieldDesc: Minimum duration to wait after the internal readiness checks have passed but before succeeding the readiness endpoint. This is used to slowdown deployment controllers (eg. Kubernetes) after an instance is ready and before they proceed with a rolling update, to give the rest of the cluster instances enough time to receive ring updates.

Entries.Name: interface_names
Entries.FieldDesc: Name of network interface to read address from.

Entries.Name: enable_inet6
Entries.FieldDesc: Enable IPv6 support. Required to make use of IP addresses from IPv6 interfaces.

Entries.Name: final_sleep
Entries.FieldDesc: Duration to sleep for before exiting, to ensure metrics are scraped.

Entries.Name: tokens_file_path
Entries.FieldDesc: File path where tokens are stored. If empty, tokens are not stored at shutdown and restored at startup.

Entries.Name: availability_zone
Entries.FieldDesc: The availability zone where this instance is running.

Entries.Name: unregister_on_shutdown
Entries.FieldDesc: Unregister from the ring upon clean shutdown. It can be useful to disable for rolling restarts with consistent naming in conjunction with -distributor.extend-writes=false.

Entries.Name: readiness_check_ring_health
Entries.FieldDesc: When enabled the readiness probe succeeds only after all instances are ACTIVE and healthy in the ring, otherwise only the instance itself is checked. This option should be disabled if in your cluster multiple instances can be rolled out simultaneously, otherwise rolling updates may be slowed down.

Entries.Name: address
Entries.FieldDesc: IP address to advertise in the ring.

Entries.Name: port
Entries.FieldDesc: port to advertise in consul (defaults to server.grpc-listen-port).

Entries.Name: id
Entries.FieldDesc: ID to register in the ring.

Entries.Name: index_gateway

Block.Name: index_gateway
Block.Desc: The index_gateway block configures the Loki index gateway server, responsible for serving index queries without the need to constantly interact with the object store.

Entries.Name: mode
Entries.FieldDesc:
Defines in which mode the index gateway server will operate (default to 'simple'). It supports two modes:
- 'simple': an index gateway server instance is responsible for handling, storing and returning requests for all indices for all tenants.
- 'ring': an index gateway server instance is responsible for a subset of tenants instead of all tenants.

Entries.Name: ring

Block.Name: ring
Block.Desc: Defines the ring to be used by the index gateway servers and clients in case the servers are configured to run in 'ring' mode. In case this isn't configured, this block supports inheriting configuration from the common ring section.

Entries.Name: store
Entries.FieldDesc: Backend storage to use for the ring. Supported values are: consul, etcd, inmemory, memberlist, multi.

Entries.Name: prefix
Entries.FieldDesc: The prefix for the keys in the store. Should end with a /.

Entries.FieldDesc: Burst size used in rate limit. Values less than 1 are treated as 1.

Entries.Name: bloom_build

Block.Name: bloom_build
Block.Desc: Experimental: The bloom_build block configures the Loki bloom planner and builder servers, responsible for building bloom filters.

Entries.Name: enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: Flag to enable or disable the usage of the bloom-planner and bloom-builder components.

Entries.Name: planning_interval
Entries.FieldDesc: Interval at which to re-run the bloom creation planning.

Entries.Name: min_table_offset
Entries.FieldDesc: Newest day-table offset (from today, inclusive) to build blooms for. 0 start building from today, 1 from yesterday and so on. Increase to lower cost by not re-writing data to object storage too frequently since recent data changes more often at the cost of not having blooms available as quickly.

Entries.Name: max_table_offset
Entries.FieldDesc: Oldest day-table offset (from today, inclusive) to build blooms for. 1 till yesterday, 2 till day before yesterday and so on. This can be used to lower cost by not trying to build blooms for older data which doesn't change. This can be optimized by aligning it with the maximum `reject_old_samples_max_age` setting of any tenant.

Entries.Name: enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: Enable bloom retention.

Entries.Name: max_queued_tasks_per_tenant
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum number of tasks to queue per tenant.

Entries.Name: store_tasks_on_disk
Entries.FieldDesc: Whether to store tasks on disk.

Entries.Name: tasks_disk_directory
Entries.FieldDesc: Directory to store tasks on disk.

Entries.Name: clean_tasks_directory
Entries.FieldDesc: Whether to clean the tasks directory on startup.

Entries.Name: dynamodb_url
Entries.FieldDesc: DynamoDB endpoint URL with escaped Key and Secret encoded. If only region is specified as a host, proper endpoint will be deduced. Use inmemory:///<table-name> to use a mock in-memory implementation.

Entries.Name: api_limit
Entries.FieldDesc: DynamoDB table management requests per second limit.

Entries.Name: throttle_limit
Entries.FieldDesc: DynamoDB rate cap to back off when throttled.

Entries.Name: url
Entries.FieldDesc: Use metrics-based autoscaling, via this query URL

Entries.Name: target_queue_length
Entries.FieldDesc: Queue length above which we will scale up capacity

Entries.Name: scale_up_factor
Entries.FieldDesc: Scale up capacity by this multiple

Entries.Name: ignore_throttle_below
Entries.FieldDesc: Ignore throttling below this level (rate per second)

Entries.Name: queue_length_query
Entries.FieldDesc: query to fetch ingester queue length

Entries.Name: write_throttle_query
Entries.FieldDesc: query to fetch throttle rates per table

Entries.Name: write_usage_query
Entries.FieldDesc: query to fetch write capacity usage per table

Entries.Name: read_usage_query
Entries.FieldDesc: query to fetch read capacity usage per table

Entries.Name: read_error_query
Entries.FieldDesc: query to fetch read errors per table

Entries.Name: chunk_gang_size
Entries.FieldDesc: Number of chunks to group together to parallelise fetches (zero to disable)

Entries.Name: chunk_get_max_parallelism
Entries.FieldDesc: Max number of chunk-get operations to start in parallel

Entries.Name: min_period
Entries.FieldDesc: Minimum backoff time

Entries.Name: max_period
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum backoff time

Entries.Name: max_retries
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum number of times to retry an operation

Entries.Name: kms_key_id
Entries.FieldDesc: KMS key used for encrypting DynamoDB items.  DynamoDB will use an Amazon owned KMS key if not provided.

Entries.BlockDesc: Deprecated: Configures storing indexes in DynamoDB.

Block.Name: s3_storage_config
Block.Desc: The s3_storage_config block configures the connection to Amazon S3 object storage backend.

Entries.Name: s3
Entries.FieldDesc: S3 endpoint URL with escaped Key and Secret encoded. If only region is specified as a host, proper endpoint will be deduced. Use inmemory:///<bucket-name> to use a mock in-memory implementation.

Entries.Name: s3forcepathstyle
Entries.FieldDesc: Set this to `true` to force the request to use path-style addressing.

Entries.Name: bucketnames
Entries.FieldDesc: Comma separated list of bucket names to evenly distribute chunks over. Overrides any buckets specified in s3.url flag

Entries.Name: endpoint
Entries.FieldDesc: S3 Endpoint to connect to.

Entries.Name: region
Entries.FieldDesc: AWS region to use.

Entries.Name: access_key_id
Entries.FieldDesc: AWS Access Key ID

Entries.Name: secret_access_key
Entries.FieldDesc: AWS Secret Access Key

Entries.Name: session_token
Entries.FieldDesc: AWS Session Token

Entries.Name: insecure
Entries.FieldDesc: Disable https on s3 connection.

Entries.Name: chunk_delimiter
Entries.FieldDesc: Delimiter used to replace the default delimiter ':' in chunk IDs when storing chunks. This is mainly intended when you run a MinIO instance on a Windows machine. You should not change this value inflight.

Entries.Name: timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: Timeout specifies a time limit for requests made by s3 Client.

Entries.Name: idle_conn_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: The maximum amount of time an idle connection will be held open.

Entries.Name: response_header_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: If non-zero, specifies the amount of time to wait for a server's response headers after fully writing the request.

Entries.Name: insecure_skip_verify
Entries.FieldDesc: Set to true to skip verifying the certificate chain and hostname.

Entries.Name: ca_file
Entries.FieldDesc: Path to the trusted CA file that signed the SSL certificate of the S3 endpoint.

Entries.Name: signature_version
Entries.FieldDesc: The signature version to use for authenticating against S3. Supported values are: v4.

Entries.Name: storage_class
Entries.FieldDesc: The S3 storage class which objects will use. Supported values are: GLACIER, DEEP_ARCHIVE, GLACIER_IR, INTELLIGENT_TIERING, ONEZONE_IA, OUTPOSTS, REDUCED_REDUNDANCY, STANDARD, STANDARD_IA.

Entries.Name: type
Entries.FieldDesc: Enable AWS Server Side Encryption. Supported values: SSE-KMS, SSE-S3.

Entries.Name: kms_key_id
Entries.FieldDesc: KMS Key ID used to encrypt objects in S3

Entries.Name: kms_encryption_context
Entries.FieldDesc: KMS Encryption Context used for object encryption. It expects JSON formatted string.

Entries.Name: backoff_config

Block.Name: backoff_config
Block.Desc: Configures back off when S3 get Object.

Entries.Name: min_period
Entries.FieldDesc: Minimum backoff time when s3 get Object

Entries.Name: max_period
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum backoff time when s3 get Object

Entries.Name: max_retries
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum number of times to retry for s3 GetObject or ObjectExists

Entries.BlockDesc: Configures back off when S3 get Object.

Entries.Name: disable_dualstack
Entries.FieldDesc: Disable forcing S3 dualstack endpoint usage.

The aws_storage_config block configures the connection to dynamoDB and S3 object storage. Either one of them or both can be configured.

Entries.Name: request_timeout

Entries.Name: max_retries
Entries.FieldDesc: Number of retries for a request which times out.

Entries.Name: min_retry_delay
Entries.FieldDesc: Minimum time to wait before retrying a request.

Entries.Name: max_retry_delay
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum time to wait before retrying a request.

Entries.Name: named_stores

Block.Name: named_stores_config
Block.Desc:
Configures additional object stores for a given storage provider.
Supported stores: aws, azure, bos, filesystem, gcs, swift.
Example:
```yaml
    storage_config:
      named_stores:
        aws:
          store-1:
            endpoint: s3://foo-bucket
            region: us-west1
```
Named store from this example can be used by setting object_store to store-1 in period_config.

Entries.BlockDesc:
Configures additional object stores for a given storage provider.
Supported stores: aws, azure, bos, filesystem, gcs, swift.
Example:
```yaml
    storage_config:
      named_stores:
        aws:
          store-1:
            endpoint: s3://foo-bucket
            region: us-west1
```
Named store from this example can be used by setting object_store to store-1 in period_config.

Entries.FieldDesc: How many key batches to buffer for background write-back. Default is large to prefer size based limiting.

Entries.FieldDesc: Size limit in bytes for background write-back.

Entries.FieldDesc: Hostname for memcached service to use. If empty and if addresses is unset, no memcached will be used.

Entries.Name: tls_cipher_suites
Entries.FieldDesc:
Override the default cipher suite list (separated by commas). Allowed values:

Secure Ciphers:
- TLS_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
- TLS_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
- TLS_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256

Insecure Ciphers:
- TLS_RSA_WITH_RC4_128_SHA
- TLS_RSA_WITH_3DES_EDE_CBC_SHA
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_RC4_128_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_RC4_128_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_3DES_EDE_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256

Entries.FieldDesc: By default, the Redis client only reads from the master node. Enabling this option can lower pressure on the master node by randomly routing read-only commands to the master and any available replicas.

Block.Name: thanos_object_store_config
Block.Desc:
The thanos_object_store_config block configures the connection to object storage backend using thanos-io/objstore clients. This will become the default way of configuring object store clients in future releases.
Currently this is opt-in and takes effect only when `-use-thanos-objstore` is set to true.

Entries.Name: endpoint
Entries.FieldDesc: The S3 bucket endpoint. It could be an AWS S3 endpoint listed at https://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/s3.html or the address of an S3-compatible service in hostname:port format.

Entries.Name: region
Entries.FieldDesc: S3 region. If unset, the client will issue a S3 GetBucketLocation API call to autodetect it.

Entries.Name: insecure
Entries.FieldDesc: If enabled, use http:// for the S3 endpoint instead of https://. This could be useful in local dev/test environments while using an S3-compatible backend storage, like Minio.

Entries.Name: list_objects_version
Entries.FieldDesc: Use a specific version of the S3 list object API. Supported values are v1 or v2. Default is unset.

Entries.Name: bucket_lookup_type
Entries.FieldDesc: Bucket lookup style type, used to access bucket in S3-compatible service. Default is auto. Supported values are: auto, path, virtual-hosted.

Entries.Name: dualstack_enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: When enabled, direct all AWS S3 requests to the dual-stack IPv4/IPv6 endpoint for the configured region.

Entries.Name: storage_class
Entries.FieldDesc: The S3 storage class to use, not set by default. Details can be found at https://aws.amazon.com/s3/storage-classes/. Supported values are: STANDARD, REDUCED_REDUNDANCY, GLACIER, STANDARD_IA, ONEZONE_IA, INTELLIGENT_TIERING, DEEP_ARCHIVE, OUTPOSTS, GLACIER_IR, SNOW, EXPRESS_ONEZONE

Entries.Name: native_aws_auth_enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: If enabled, it will use the default authentication methods of the AWS SDK for go based on known environment variables and known AWS config files.

Entries.Name: part_size
Entries.FieldDesc: The minimum file size in bytes used for multipart uploads. If 0, the value is optimally computed for each object.

Entries.Name: send_content_md5
Entries.FieldDesc: If enabled, a Content-MD5 header is sent with S3 Put Object requests. Consumes more resources to compute the MD5, but may improve compatibility with object storage services that do not support checksums.

Entries.Name: sts_endpoint
Entries.FieldDesc: Accessing S3 resources using temporary, secure credentials provided by AWS Security Token Service.

Entries.Name: max_retries
Entries.FieldDesc: The maximum number of retries for S3 requests that are retryable. Default is 10, set this to 1 to disable retries.

Entries.Name: type
Entries.FieldDesc: Enable AWS Server Side Encryption. Supported values: SSE-KMS, SSE-S3.

Entries.Name: kms_key_id
Entries.FieldDesc: KMS Key ID used to encrypt objects in S3

Entries.FieldDesc: The amount of time the client will wait for a servers response headers.

Entries.FieldDesc: If the client connects via HTTPS and this option is enabled, the client will accept any certificate and hostname.

Entries.Name: tls_handshake_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum time to wait for a TLS handshake. 0 means no limit.

Entries.Name: expect_continue_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: The time to wait for a server's first response headers after fully writing the request headers if the request has an Expect header. 0 to send the request body immediately.

Entries.Name: max_idle_connections
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum number of idle (keep-alive) connections across all hosts. 0 means no limit.

Entries.Name: max_idle_connections_per_host
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum number of idle (keep-alive) connections to keep per-host. If 0, a built-in default value is used.

Entries.Name: max_connections_per_host
