Entries.Name: service_account
Entries.FieldDesc:
JSON either from a Google Developers Console client_credentials.json file, or a Google Developers service account key. Needs to be valid JSON, not a filesystem path. If empty, fallback to Google default logic:
1. A JSON file whose path is specified by the GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIALS environment variable. For workload identity federation, refer to https://cloud.google.com/iam/docs/how-to#using-workload-identity-federation on how to generate the JSON configuration file for on-prem/non-Google cloud platforms.
2. A JSON file in a location known to the gcloud command-line tool: $HOME/.config/gcloud/application_default_credentials.json.
3. On Google Compute Engine it fetches credentials from the metadata server.

Entries.Name: boltdb_shipper

Block.Name: boltdb_shipper
Block.Desc: Configures storing index in an Object Store (GCS/S3/Azure/Swift/COS/Filesystem) in the form of boltdb files. Required fields only required when boltdb-shipper is defined in config.

Entries.Name: active_index_directory
Entries.FieldDesc: Directory where ingesters would write index files which would then be uploaded by shipper to configured storage

Entries.Name: cache_location
Entries.FieldDesc: Cache location for restoring index files from storage for queries

Entries.Name: cache_ttl
Entries.FieldDesc: TTL for index files restored in cache for queries

Entries.Name: resync_interval
Entries.FieldDesc: Resync downloaded files with the storage

Entries.Name: query_ready_num_days
Entries.FieldDesc: Number of days of common index to be kept downloaded for queries. For per tenant index query readiness, use limits overrides config.

Entries.Name: grpc_client_config

Block.Name: grpc_client
Block.Desc: The grpc_client block configures the gRPC client used to communicate between a client and server component in Loki.

Entries.Name: max_recv_msg_size
Entries.FieldDesc: gRPC client max receive message size (bytes).

Entries.Name: max_send_msg_size
Entries.FieldDesc: gRPC client max send message size (bytes).

Entries.Name: grpc_compression
Entries.FieldDesc: Use compression when sending messages. Supported values are: gzip, snappy, ''

Entries.Name: rate_limit
Entries.FieldDesc: Rate limit for gRPC client; 0 means disabled.

Entries.Name: rate_limit_burst
Entries.FieldDesc: Rate limit burst for gRPC client.

Entries.Name: backoff_on_ratelimits
Entries.FieldDesc: Enable backoff and retry when we hit rate limits.

Entries.Name: min_period
Entries.FieldDesc: Minimum delay when backing off.

Entries.Name: max_period
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum delay when backing off.

Entries.Name: max_retries
Entries.FieldDesc: Number of times to backoff and retry before failing.

Entries.Name: initial_stream_window_size
Entries.FieldDesc: Initial stream window size. Values less than the default are not supported and are ignored. Setting this to a value other than the default disables the BDP estimator.

Entries.Name: initial_connection_window_size
Entries.FieldDesc: Initial connection window size. Values less than the default are not supported and are ignored. Setting this to a value other than the default disables the BDP estimator.

Entries.Name: tls_enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: Enable TLS in the gRPC client. This flag needs to be enabled when any other TLS flag is set. If set to false, insecure connection to gRPC server will be used.

Block.Name: tls_config
Block.Desc: The TLS configuration.

Entries.Name: tls_cert_path
Entries.FieldDesc: Path to the client certificate, which will be used for authenticating with the server. Also requires the key path to be configured.

Entries.Name: tls_key_path
Entries.FieldDesc: Path to the key for the client certificate. Also requires the client certificate to be configured.

Entries.Name: tls_ca_path
Entries.FieldDesc: Path to the CA certificates to validate server certificate against. If not set, the host's root CA certificates are used.

Entries.Name: tls_server_name
Entries.FieldDesc: Override the expected name on the server certificate.

Entries.Name: tls_insecure_skip_verify
Entries.FieldDesc: Skip validating server certificate.

Entries.Name: tls_cipher_suites
Entries.FieldDesc:
Override the default cipher suite list (separated by commas). Allowed values:

Secure Ciphers:
- TLS_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
- TLS_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
- TLS_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256

Insecure Ciphers:
- TLS_RSA_WITH_RC4_128_SHA
- TLS_RSA_WITH_3DES_EDE_CBC_SHA
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_RC4_128_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_RC4_128_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_3DES_EDE_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256

Entries.Name: tls_min_version
Entries.FieldDesc: Override the default minimum TLS version. Allowed values: VersionTLS10, VersionTLS11, VersionTLS12, VersionTLS13

Entries.BlockDesc: The TLS configuration.

Entries.Name: connect_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: The maximum amount of time to establish a connection. A value of 0 means default gRPC client connect timeout and backoff.

Entries.Name: connect_backoff_base_delay
Entries.FieldDesc: Initial backoff delay after first connection failure. Only relevant if ConnectTimeout > 0.

Entries.Name: connect_backoff_max_delay
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum backoff delay when establishing a connection. Only relevant if ConnectTimeout > 0.

Entries.Name: label
Entries.FieldDesc: Optionally define the cluster validation label.

Entries.BlockDesc: The grpc_client block configures the gRPC client used to communicate between a client and server component in Loki.

Entries.Name: server_address
Entries.FieldDesc: Hostname or IP of the Index Gateway gRPC server running in simple mode. Can also be prefixed with dns+, dnssrv+, or dnssrvnoa+ to resolve a DNS A record with multiple IP's, a DNS SRV record with a followup A record lookup, or a DNS SRV record without a followup A record lookup, respectively.

Entries.Name: log_gateway_requests
Entries.FieldDesc: Whether requests sent to the gateway should be logged or not.

Entries.Name: build_per_tenant_index
Entries.FieldDesc: Build per tenant index files

Entries.BlockDesc: Configures storing index in an Object Store (GCS/S3/Azure/Swift/COS/Filesystem) in the form of boltdb files. Required fields only required when boltdb-shipper is defined in config.

Entries.Name: bloom_shipper

Block.Name: bloom_shipper
Block.Desc: Experimental: Configures the bloom shipper component, which contains the store abstraction to fetch bloom filters from and put them to object storage.

Entries.Name: working_directory
Entries.FieldDesc: Working directory to store downloaded bloom blocks. Supports multiple directories, separated by comma.

Entries.Name: max_query_page_size
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum size of bloom pages that should be queried. Larger pages than this limit are skipped when querying blooms to limit memory usage.

Entries.Name: download_parallelism
Entries.FieldDesc: The amount of maximum concurrent bloom blocks downloads. Usually set to 2x number of CPU cores.

Entries.Name: soft_limit
Entries.FieldDesc: Cache for bloom blocks. Soft limit of the cache in bytes. Exceeding this limit will trigger evictions of least recently used items in the background.

Entries.Name: hard_limit
Entries.FieldDesc: Cache for bloom blocks. Hard limit of the cache in bytes. Exceeding this limit will block execution until soft limit is deceeded.

Entries.Name: ttl
Entries.FieldDesc: Cache for bloom blocks. The time to live for items in the cache before they get purged.

Entries.Name: metas_cache

Block.Name: cache_config
Block.Desc: The cache_config block configures the cache backend for a specific Loki component.

Entries.Name: default_validity
Entries.FieldDesc: Cache for bloom metas. The default validity of entries for caches unless overridden.

Entries.Name: writeback_goroutines
Entries.FieldDesc: Cache for bloom metas. At what concurrency to write back to cache.

Entries.Name: writeback_buffer
Entries.FieldDesc: Cache for bloom metas. How many key batches to buffer for background write-back. Default is large to prefer size based limiting.

Entries.Name: writeback_size_limit
Entries.FieldDesc: Cache for bloom metas. Size limit in bytes for background write-back.

Entries.Name: expiration
Entries.FieldDesc: Cache for bloom metas. How long keys stay in the memcache.

Entries.Name: batch_size
Entries.FieldDesc: Cache for bloom metas. How many keys to fetch in each batch.

Entries.Name: parallelism
Entries.FieldDesc: Cache for bloom metas. Maximum active requests to memcache.

Entries.Name: host
Entries.FieldDesc: Cache for bloom metas. Hostname for memcached service to use. If empty and if addresses is unset, no memcached will be used.

Entries.Name: service
Entries.FieldDesc: Cache for bloom metas. SRV service used to discover memcache servers.

Entries.Name: addresses
Entries.FieldDesc: Cache for bloom metas. Comma separated addresses list in DNS Service Discovery format: https://grafana.com/docs/mimir/latest/configure/about-dns-service-discovery/#supported-discovery-modes

Entries.Name: timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: Cache for bloom metas. Maximum time to wait before giving up on memcached requests.

Entries.Name: max_idle_conns
Entries.FieldDesc: Cache for bloom metas. Maximum number of idle connections in pool.

Entries.Name: max_item_size
Entries.FieldDesc: Cache for bloom metas. The maximum size of an item stored in memcached. Bigger items are not stored. If set to 0, no maximum size is enforced.

Entries.Name: update_interval
Entries.FieldDesc: Cache for bloom metas. Period with which to poll DNS for memcache servers.

Entries.Name: consistent_hash
Entries.FieldDesc: Cache for bloom metas. Use consistent hashing to distribute to memcache servers.

Entries.Name: circuit_breaker_consecutive_failures
Entries.FieldDesc: Cache for bloom metas. Trip circuit-breaker after this number of consecutive dial failures (if zero then circuit-breaker is disabled).

Entries.Name: circuit_breaker_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: Cache for bloom metas. Duration circuit-breaker remains open after tripping (if zero then 60 seconds is used).

Entries.Name: circuit_breaker_interval
Entries.FieldDesc: Cache for bloom metas. Reset circuit-breaker counts after this long (if zero then never reset).

Entries.Name: tls_enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: Enable connecting to Memcached with TLS.

Block.Name: tls_config
Block.Desc: The TLS configuration.

Entries.Name: tls_cert_path
Entries.FieldDesc: Path to the client certificate, which will be used for authenticating with the server. Also requires the key path to be configured.

Entries.Name: tls_key_path
Entries.FieldDesc: Path to the key for the client certificate. Also requires the client certificate to be configured.

Entries.FieldDesc: Path to the CA certificates to validate server certificate against. If not set, the host's root CA certificates are used.

Entries.Name: tls_server_name
Entries.FieldDesc: Override the expected name on the server certificate.

Entries.Name: tls_insecure_skip_verify
Entries.FieldDesc: Skip validating server certificate.

Entries.Name: tls_cipher_suites
Entries.FieldDesc:
Override the default cipher suite list (separated by commas). Allowed values:

Secure Ciphers:
- TLS_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
- TLS_AES_256_GCM_SHA384

- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256

Insecure Ciphers:
- TLS_RSA_WITH_RC4_128_SHA
- TLS_RSA_WITH_3DES_EDE_CBC_SHA
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_RC4_128_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_RC4_128_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_3DES_EDE_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256

Entries.Name: tls_min_version
Entries.FieldDesc: Override the default minimum TLS version. Allowed values: VersionTLS10, VersionTLS11, VersionTLS12, VersionTLS13

Entries.BlockDesc: The TLS configuration.

Entries.Name: endpoint
Entries.FieldDesc: Cache for bloom metas. Redis Server or Cluster configuration endpoint to use for caching. A comma-separated list of endpoints for Redis Cluster or Redis Sentinel. If empty, no redis will be used.

Entries.Name: master_name
Entries.FieldDesc: Cache for bloom metas. Redis Sentinel master name. An empty string for Redis Server or Redis Cluster.

Entries.Name: timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: Cache for bloom metas. Maximum time to wait before giving up on redis requests.

Entries.Name: expiration
Entries.FieldDesc: Cache for bloom metas. How long keys stay in the redis.

Entries.Name: db
Entries.FieldDesc: Cache for bloom metas. Database index.

Entries.Name: pool_size
Entries.FieldDesc: Cache for bloom metas. Maximum number of connections in the pool.

Entries.Name: username
Entries.FieldDesc: Cache for bloom metas. Username to use when connecting to redis.

Entries.Name: password
Entries.FieldDesc: Cache for bloom metas. Password to use when connecting to redis.

Entries.Name: tls_enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: Cache for bloom metas. Enable connecting to redis with TLS.

Entries.Name: tls_insecure_skip_verify
Entries.FieldDesc: Cache for bloom metas. Skip validating server certificate.

Entries.Name: idle_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: Cache for bloom metas. Close connections after remaining idle for this duration. If the value is zero, then idle connections are not closed.

Entries.Name: max_connection_age
Entries.FieldDesc: Cache for bloom metas. Close connections older than this duration. If the value is zero, then the pool does not close connections based on age.

Entries.Name: route_randomly
Entries.FieldDesc: Cache for bloom metas. By default, the Redis client only reads from the master node. Enabling this option can lower pressure on the master node by randomly routing read-only commands to the master and any available replicas.

Entries.Name: enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: Cache for bloom metas. Whether embedded cache is enabled.

Entries.Name: max_size_mb
Entries.FieldDesc: Cache for bloom metas. Maximum memory size of the cache in MB.

Entries.Name: max_size_items
Entries.FieldDesc: Cache for bloom metas. Maximum number of entries in the cache.

Entries.Name: ttl
Entries.FieldDesc: Cache for bloom metas. The time to live for items in the cache before they get purged.

Entries.BlockDesc: The cache_config block configures the cache backend for a specific Loki component.

Entries.Name: enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: In-memory LRU cache for bloom metas. Whether embedded cache is enabled.

Entries.Name: max_size_mb
Entries.FieldDesc: In-memory LRU cache for bloom metas. Maximum memory size of the cache in MB.

Entries.Name: max_size_items
Entries.FieldDesc: In-memory LRU cache for bloom metas. Maximum number of entries in the cache.

Entries.Name: ttl
Entries.FieldDesc: In-memory LRU cache for bloom metas. The time to live for items in the cache before they get purged.

Entries.BlockDesc: Experimental: Configures the bloom shipper component, which contains the store abstraction to fetch bloom filters from and put them to object storage.
The storage_config block configures one of many possible stores for both the index and chunks. Which configuration to be picked should be defined in schema_config block.

Block.Desc: The chunk_store_config block configures how chunks will be cached and how long to wait before saving them to the backing store.

Entries.FieldDesc: The default validity of entries for caches unless overridden.

Entries.Name: writeback_goroutines
Entries.FieldDesc: At what concurrency to write back to cache.

Entries.FieldDesc: How many key batches to buffer for background write-back. Default is large to prefer size based limiting.

Entries.Name: writeback_size_limit
Entries.FieldDesc: Size limit in bytes for background write-back.

Entries.Name: expiration
Entries.FieldDesc: How long keys stay in the memcache.

Entries.Name: batch_size
Entries.FieldDesc: How many keys to fetch in each batch.

Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum active requests to memcache.

Entries.Name: host
Entries.FieldDesc: Hostname for memcached service to use. If empty and if addresses is unset, no memcached will be used.

Entries.Name: service
Entries.FieldDesc: SRV service used to discover memcache servers.

Entries.Name: addresses
Entries.FieldDesc: Comma separated addresses list in DNS Service Discovery format: https://grafana.com/docs/mimir/latest/configure/about-dns-service-discovery/#supported-discovery-modes

Entries.Name: timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum time to wait before giving up on memcached requests.

Entries.Name: max_idle_conns
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum number of idle connections in pool.

Entries.Name: max_item_size
Entries.FieldDesc: The maximum size of an item stored in memcached. Bigger items are not stored. If set to 0, no maximum size is enforced.

Entries.Name: update_interval
Entries.FieldDesc: Period with which to poll DNS for memcache servers.

Entries.Name: consistent_hash
Entries.FieldDesc: Use consistent hashing to distribute to memcache servers.

Entries.Name: circuit_breaker_consecutive_failures
Entries.FieldDesc: Trip circuit-breaker after this number of consecutive dial failures (if zero then circuit-breaker is disabled).

Entries.Name: circuit_breaker_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: Duration circuit-breaker remains open after tripping (if zero then 60 seconds is used).

Entries.Name: circuit_breaker_interval
Entries.FieldDesc: Reset circuit-breaker counts after this long (if zero then never reset).

Entries.Name: skip_query_writeback_cache_older_than
Entries.FieldDesc: Chunks fetched from queriers before this duration will not be written to the cache. A value of 0 will write all chunks to the cache

Entries.Name: l2_chunk_cache_handoff
Entries.FieldDesc: Chunks will be handed off to the L2 cache after this duration. 0 to disable L2 cache.

Entries.Name: cache_lookups_older_than

Entries.BlockDesc: The chunk_store_config block configures how chunks will be cached and how long to wait before saving them to the backing store.

Entries.Name: schema_config

Block.Name: schema_config
Block.Desc: Configures the chunk index schema and where it is stored.

Entries.BlockDesc: Configures the chunk index schema and where it is stored.

Entries.Name: compactor

Block.Name: compactor
Block.Desc: The compactor block configures the compactor component, which compacts index shards for performance.

Entries.Name: working_directory
Entries.FieldDesc: Directory where files can be downloaded for compaction.

Entries.Name: compaction_interval
Entries.FieldDesc: Interval at which to re-run the compaction operation.

Entries.Name: apply_retention_interval
Entries.FieldDesc: Interval at which to apply/enforce retention. 0 means run at same interval as compaction. If non-zero, it should always be a multiple of compaction interval.

Entries.Name: retention_enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: Activate custom (per-stream,per-tenant) retention.

Entries.Name: retention_delete_delay
Entries.FieldDesc: Delay after which chunks will be fully deleted during retention.

Entries.Name: retention_delete_worker_count
Entries.FieldDesc: The total amount of worker to use to delete chunks.

Entries.Name: retention_table_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: The maximum amount of time to spend running retention and deletion on any given table in the index.

Entries.Name: min_period
Entries.FieldDesc: Minimum delay when backing off.

Entries.Name: max_period
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum delay when backing off.

Entries.Name: max_retries
Entries.FieldDesc: Number of times to backoff and retry before failing.

Entries.Name: delete_request_store
Entries.FieldDesc: Store used for managing delete requests.

Entries.Name: delete_request_store_key_prefix
Entries.FieldDesc: Path prefix for storing delete requests.

Entries.Name: delete_request_store_db_type
Entries.FieldDesc: Type of DB to use for storing delete requests. Supported types: boltdb, sqlite

Entries.Name: backup_delete_request_store_db_type
Entries.FieldDesc: Type of DB to use as backup for storing delete requests. Backup DB should ideally be used while migrating from one DB type to another. Supported type(s): boltdb

Entries.Name: delete_batch_size
Entries.FieldDesc: The max number of delete requests to run per compaction cycle.

Entries.Name: delete_request_cancel_period
Entries.FieldDesc: Allow cancellation of delete request until duration after they are created. Data would be deleted only after delete requests have been older than this duration. Ideally this should be set to at least 24h.

Entries.Name: delete_max_interval
Entries.FieldDesc: Constrain the size of any single delete request with line filters. When a delete request > delete_max_interval is input, the request is sharded into smaller requests of no more than delete_max_interval

Entries.Name: max_compaction_parallelism
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum number of tables to compact in parallel. While increasing this value, please make sure compactor has enough disk space allocated to be able to store and compact as many tables.

Entries.Name: upload_parallelism
Entries.FieldDesc: Number of upload/remove operations to execute in parallel when finalizing a compaction. NOTE: This setting is per compaction operation, which can be executed in parallel. The upper bound on the number of concurrent uploads is upload_parallelism * max_compaction_parallelism.

Entries.Name: compactor_ring

Block.Name: compactor_ring
Block.Desc: The hash ring configuration used by compactors to elect a single instance for running compactions. The CLI flags prefix for this block config is: compactor.ring

Entries.Name: store
Entries.FieldDesc: Backend storage to use for the ring. Supported values are: consul, etcd, inmemory, memberlist, multi.

Entries.Name: prefix
Entries.FieldDesc: The prefix for the keys in the store. Should end with a /.

Entries.Name: consul

Block.Name: consul
Block.Desc: Configuration for a Consul client. Only applies if the selected kvstore is consul.

Entries.Name: host
Entries.FieldDesc: Hostname and port of Consul.

Entries.Name: acl_token
Entries.FieldDesc: ACL Token used to interact with Consul.

Entries.Name: http_client_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: HTTP timeout when talking to Consul

Entries.Name: consistent_reads
Entries.FieldDesc: Enable consistent reads to Consul.

Entries.Name: watch_rate_limit
Entries.FieldDesc: Rate limit when watching key or prefix in Consul, in requests per second. 0 disables the rate limit.

Entries.Name: watch_burst_size
Entries.FieldDesc: Burst size used in rate limit. Values less than 1 are treated as 1.

Entries.Name: cas_retry_delay
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum duration to wait before retrying a Compare And Swap (CAS) operation.

Entries.BlockDesc: Configuration for a Consul client. Only applies if the selected kvstore is consul.

Entries.Name: max_retries
Entries.FieldDesc: The maximum number of retries to do for failed ops.

Entries.Name: tls_enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: Enable TLS.

Entries.Name: password
Entries.FieldDesc: Etcd password.

Entries.BlockDesc: Configuration for an ETCD v3 client. Only applies if the selected kvstore is etcd.

Entries.Name: primary
Entries.FieldDesc: Primary backend storage used by multi-client.

Entries.Name: secondary
Entries.FieldDesc: Secondary backend storage used by multi-client.

Entries.Name: mirror_enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: Mirror writes to secondary store.

Entries.Name: mirror_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: Timeout for storing value to secondary store.

Entries.Name: heartbeat_period
Entries.FieldDesc: Period at which to heartbeat to the ring. 0 = disabled.

Entries.Name: heartbeat_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: The heartbeat timeout after which compactors are considered unhealthy within the ring. 0 = never (timeout disabled).

Entries.Name: tokens_file_path
Entries.FieldDesc: File path where tokens are stored. If empty, tokens are not stored at shutdown and restored at startup.

Entries.Name: zone_awareness_enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: True to enable zone-awareness and replicate blocks across different availability zones.

Entries.Name: num_tokens
Entries.FieldDesc: IGNORED: Num tokens is fixed to 1

Entries.Name: replication_factor
Entries.FieldDesc: IGNORED: Replication factor is fixed to 1

Entries.Name: instance_id
Entries.FieldDesc: Instance ID to register in the ring.

Entries.Name: instance_interface_names
Entries.FieldDesc: Name of network interface to read address from.

Entries.Name: instance_port
Entries.FieldDesc: Port to advertise in the ring (defaults to server.grpc-listen-port).

Entries.Name: instance_addr
Entries.FieldDesc: IP address to advertise in the ring.

Entries.Name: instance_availability_zone
Entries.FieldDesc: The availability zone where this instance is running. Required if zone-awareness is enabled.

Entries.Name: instance_enable_ipv6
Entries.FieldDesc: Enable using a IPv6 instance address.

Entries.BlockDesc: The hash ring configuration used by compactors to elect a single instance for running compactions. The CLI flags prefix for this block config is: compactor.ring

Entries.Name: tables_to_compact
Entries.FieldDesc: Number of tables that compactor will try to compact. Newer tables are chosen when this is less than the number of tables available.

Entries.Name: skip_latest_n_tables
Entries.FieldDesc: Do not compact N latest tables. Together with -compactor.run-once and -compactor.tables-to-compact, this is useful when clearing compactor backlogs.

Entries.BlockDesc: The compactor block configures the compactor component, which compacts index shards for performance.

Block.Name: grpc_client
Block.Desc: The grpc_client block configures the gRPC client used to communicate between a client and server component in Loki.

Entries.Name: max_recv_msg_size
Entries.FieldDesc: gRPC client max receive message size (bytes).

Entries.Name: max_send_msg_size
Entries.FieldDesc: gRPC client max send message size (bytes).

Entries.Name: grpc_compression
Entries.FieldDesc: Use compression when sending messages. Supported values are: gzip, snappy, ''

Entries.Name: rate_limit
Entries.FieldDesc: Rate limit for gRPC client; 0 means disabled.

Entries.Name: rate_limit_burst
Entries.FieldDesc: Rate limit burst for gRPC client.

Entries.Name: backoff_on_ratelimits
Entries.FieldDesc: Enable backoff and retry when we hit rate limits.

Entries.Name: min_period
Entries.FieldDesc: Minimum delay when backing off.

Entries.Name: max_period
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum delay when backing off.

Entries.Name: max_retries
Entries.FieldDesc: Number of times to backoff and retry before failing.

Entries.Name: initial_stream_window_size
Entries.FieldDesc: Initial stream window size. Values less than the default are not supported and are ignored. Setting this to a value other than the default disables the BDP estimator.

Entries.Name: initial_connection_window_size
Entries.FieldDesc: Initial connection window size. Values less than the default are not supported and are ignored. Setting this to a value other than the default disables the BDP estimator.

Entries.Name: tls_enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: Enable TLS in the gRPC client. This flag needs to be enabled when any other TLS flag is set. If set to false, insecure connection to gRPC server will be used.

- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256

Insecure Ciphers:
- TLS_RSA_WITH_RC4_128_SHA
- TLS_RSA_WITH_3DES_EDE_CBC_SHA
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_RC4_128_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_RC4_128_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_3DES_EDE_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256

Entries.Name: tls_min_version
Entries.FieldDesc: Override the default minimum TLS version. Allowed values: VersionTLS10, VersionTLS11, VersionTLS12, VersionTLS13

Entries.BlockDesc: The TLS configuration.

Entries.Name: connect_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: The maximum amount of time to establish a connection. A value of 0 means default gRPC client connect timeout and backoff.

Entries.Name: connect_backoff_base_delay
Entries.FieldDesc: Initial backoff delay after first connection failure. Only relevant if ConnectTimeout > 0.

Entries.Name: connect_backoff_max_delay
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum backoff delay when establishing a connection. Only relevant if ConnectTimeout > 0.

Entries.Name: label
Entries.FieldDesc: Optionally define the cluster validation label.

Entries.BlockDesc: The grpc_client block configures the gRPC client used to communicate between a client and server component in Loki.

Entries.Name: limits_config

Block.Name: limits_config
Block.Desc: The limits_config block configures global and per-tenant limits in Loki. The values here can be overridden in the `overrides` section of the runtime_config file

Entries.Name: ingestion_rate_strategy
Entries.FieldDesc:
Whether the ingestion rate limit should be applied individually to each distributor instance (local), or evenly shared across the cluster (global). The ingestion rate strategy cannot be overridden on a per-tenant basis.
- local: enforces the limit on a per distributor basis. The actual effective rate limit will be N times higher, where N is the number of distributor replicas.
- global: enforces the limit globally, configuring a per-distributor local rate limiter as 'ingestion_rate / N', where N is the number of distributor replicas (it's automatically adjusted if the number of replicas change). The global strategy requires the distributors to form their own ring, which is used to keep track of the current number of healthy distributor replicas.

Entries.Name: ingestion_rate_mb
Entries.FieldDesc: Per-user ingestion rate limit in sample size per second. Sample size includes size of the logs line and the size of structured metadata labels. Units in MB.

Entries.Name: ingestion_burst_size_mb
Entries.FieldDesc: Per-user allowed ingestion burst size (in sample size). Units in MB. The burst size refers to the per-distributor local rate limiter even in the case of the 'global' strategy, and should be set at least to the maximum logs size expected in a single push request.

Entries.Name: max_label_name_length
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum length accepted for label names.

Entries.Name: max_label_value_length
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum length accepted for label value. This setting also applies to the metric name.

Entries.Name: max_label_names_per_series
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum number of label names per series.

Entries.Name: reject_old_samples
Entries.FieldDesc: Whether or not old samples will be rejected.

Entries.Name: reject_old_samples_max_age
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum accepted sample age before rejecting.

Entries.Name: creation_grace_period
Entries.FieldDesc: Duration which table will be created/deleted before/after it's needed; we won't accept sample from before this time.

Entries.Name: max_line_size
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum line size on ingestion path. Example: 256kb. Any log line exceeding this limit will be discarded unless `distributor.max-line-size-truncate` is set which in case it is truncated instead of discarding it completely. There is no limit when unset or set to 0.

Entries.Name: max_line_size_truncate
Entries.FieldDesc: Whether to truncate lines that exceed max_line_size.

Entries.Name: increment_duplicate_timestamp
Entries.FieldDesc: Alter the log line timestamp during ingestion when the timestamp is the same as the previous entry for the same stream. When enabled, if a log line in a push request has the same timestamp as the previous line for the same stream, one nanosecond is added to the log line. This will preserve the received order of log lines with the exact same timestamp when they are queried, by slightly altering their stored timestamp. NOTE: This is imperfect, because Loki accepts out of order writes, and another push request for the same stream could contain duplicate timestamps to existing entries and they will not be incremented.

Entries.Name: simulated_push_latency
Entries.FieldDesc: Simulated latency to add to push requests. Used for testing. Set to 0s to disable.

Entries.Name: enable_multi_variant_queries
Entries.FieldDesc: Enable experimental support for running multiple query variants over the same underlying data. For example, running both a rate() and count_over_time() query over the same range selector.

Entries.Name: discover_generic_fields

Block.Name: discover_generic_fields
Block.Desc: Experimental: Detect fields from stream labels, structured metadata, or json/logfmt formatted log line and put them into structured metadata of the log entry.

Entries.Name: fields
Entries.FieldType: map of string to list of strings

Entries.BlockDesc: Experimental: Detect fields from stream labels, structured metadata, or json/logfmt formatted log line and put them into structured metadata of the log entry.

Entries.Name: discover_service_name
Entries.FieldDesc: If no service_name label exists, Loki maps a single label from the configured list to service_name. If none of the configured labels exist in the stream, label is set to unknown_service. Empty list disables setting the label.
Entries.FieldDefault: [service app application app_name name app_kubernetes_io_name container container_name k8s_container_name component workload job k8s_job_name]

Entries.Name: discover_log_levels
Entries.FieldDesc: Discover and add log levels during ingestion, if not present already. Levels would be added to Structured Metadata with name level/LEVEL/Level/Severity/severity/SEVERITY/lvl/LVL/Lvl (case-sensitive) and one of the values from 'trace', 'debug', 'info', 'warn', 'error', 'critical', 'fatal' (case insensitive).

Entries.Name: log_level_fields
Entries.FieldDesc: Field name to use for log levels. If not set, log level would be detected based on pre-defined labels as mentioned above.
Entries.FieldDefault: [level LEVEL Level Severity severity SEVERITY lvl LVL Lvl severity_text Severity_Text SEVERITY_TEXT]

Entries.Name: log_level_from_json_max_depth
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum depth to search for log level fields in JSON logs. A value of 0 or less means unlimited depth. Default is 2 which searches the first 2 levels of the JSON object.

Entries.Name: use_owned_stream_count
Entries.FieldDesc: When true an ingester takes into account only the streams that it owns according to the ring while applying the stream limit.

Entries.Name: max_streams_per_user
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum number of active streams per user, per ingester. 0 to disable.

Entries.Name: max_global_streams_per_user
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum number of active streams per user, across the cluster. 0 to disable. When the global limit is enabled, each ingester is configured with a dynamic local limit based on the replication factor and the current number of healthy ingesters, and is kept updated whenever the number of ingesters change.

Entries.Name: unordered_writes
Entries.FieldDesc: Deprecated. When true, out-of-order writes are accepted.

Entries.Name: per_stream_rate_limit
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum byte rate per second per stream, also expressible in human readable forms (1MB, 256KB, etc).

Entries.Name: per_stream_rate_limit_burst
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum burst bytes per stream, also expressible in human readable forms (1MB, 256KB, etc). This is how far above the rate limit a stream can 'burst' before the stream is limited.

Entries.Name: max_chunks_per_query
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum number of chunks that can be fetched in a single query.

Entries.Name: max_query_series
Entries.FieldDesc: Limit the maximum of unique series that is returned by a metric query. When the limit is reached an error is returned.

Entries.Name: max_query_lookback
Entries.FieldDesc: Limit how far back in time series data and metadata can be queried, up until lookback duration ago. This limit is enforced in the query frontend, the querier and the ruler. If the requested time range is outside the allowed range, the request will not fail, but will be modified to only query data within the allowed time range. The default value of 0 does not set a limit.

Entries.Name: max_query_length
Entries.FieldDesc: The limit to length of chunk store queries. 0 to disable.

Entries.Name: max_query_range
Entries.FieldDesc: Limit the length of the [range] inside a range query. Default is 0 or unlimited

Entries.Name: max_query_parallelism
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum number of queries that will be scheduled in parallel by the frontend.

Entries.Name: tsdb_max_query_parallelism
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum number of queries will be scheduled in parallel by the frontend for TSDB schemas.

Entries.Name: tsdb_max_bytes_per_shard
Entries.FieldDesc: Target maximum number of bytes assigned to a single sharded query. Also expressible in human readable forms (1GB, etc). Note: This is a _target_ and not an absolute limit. The actual limit can be higher, but the query planner will try to build shards up to this limit.

Entries.Name: tsdb_sharding_strategy
Entries.FieldDesc: sharding strategy to use in query planning. Suggested to use bounded once all nodes can recognize it.

Entries.Name: tsdb_precompute_chunks
Entries.FieldDesc: Precompute chunks for TSDB queries. This can improve query performance at the cost of increased memory usage by computing chunks once during planning, reducing index calls.

Entries.Name: cardinality_limit
Entries.FieldDesc: Cardinality limit for index queries.

Entries.Name: max_streams_matchers_per_query
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum number of stream matchers per query.

Entries.Name: max_concurrent_tail_requests
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum number of concurrent tail requests.

Entries.Name: max_entries_limit_per_query
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum number of log entries that will be returned for a query.

Entries.Name: max_cache_freshness_per_query
Entries.FieldDesc: Most recent allowed cacheable result per-tenant, to prevent caching very recent results that might still be in flux.

Entries.Name: max_metadata_cache_freshness
Entries.FieldDesc: Do not cache metadata request if the end time is within the frontend.max-metadata-cache-freshness window. Set this to 0 to apply no such limits. Defaults to 24h.

Entries.Name: max_stats_cache_freshness
Entries.FieldDesc: Do not cache requests with an end time that falls within Now minus this duration. 0 disables this feature (default).

Entries.Name: max_queriers_per_tenant
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum number of queriers that can handle requests for a single tenant. If set to 0 or value higher than number of available queriers, *all* queriers will handle requests for the tenant. Each frontend (or query-scheduler, if used) will select the same set of queriers for the same tenant (given that all queriers are connected to all frontends / query-schedulers). This option only works with queriers connecting to the query-frontend / query-scheduler, not when using downstream URL.

Entries.Name: max_query_capacity
Entries.FieldDesc: How much of the available query capacity ("querier" components in distributed mode, "read" components in SSD mode) can be used by a single tenant. Allowed values are 0.0 to 1.0. For example, setting this to 0.5 would allow a tenant to use half of the available queriers for processing the query workload. If set to 0, query capacity is determined by frontend.max-queriers-per-tenant. When both frontend.max-queriers-per-tenant and frontend.max-query-capacity are configured, smaller value of the resulting querier replica count is considered: min(frontend.max-queriers-per-tenant, ceil(querier_replicas * frontend.max-query-capacity)). *All* queriers will handle requests for the tenant if neither limits are applied. This option only works with queriers connecting to the query-frontend / query-scheduler, not when using downstream URL. Use this feature in a multi-tenant setup where you need to limit query capacity for certain tenants.

Entries.Name: query_ready_index_num_days
Entries.FieldDesc: Number of days of index to be kept always downloaded for queries. Applies only to per user index in boltdb-shipper index store. 0 to disable.

Entries.Name: query_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: Timeout when querying backends (ingesters or storage) during the execution of a query request. When a specific per-tenant timeout is used, the global timeout is ignored.

Entries.Name: split_queries_by_interval
Entries.FieldDesc: Split queries by a time interval and execute in parallel. The value 0 disables splitting by time. This also determines how cache keys are chosen when result caching is enabled.

Entries.Name: split_metadata_queries_by_interval
Entries.FieldDesc: Split metadata queries by a time interval and execute in parallel. The value 0 disables splitting metadata queries by time. This also determines how cache keys are chosen when label/series result caching is enabled.

Entries.Name: split_recent_metadata_queries_by_interval
Entries.FieldDesc: Experimental. Split interval to use for the portion of metadata request that falls within `recent_metadata_query_window`. Rest of the request which is outside the window still uses `split_metadata_queries_by_interval`. If set to 0, the entire request defaults to using a split interval of `split_metadata_queries_by_interval.`.

Entries.Name: recent_metadata_query_window
Entries.FieldDesc:
Experimental. Metadata query window inside which `split_recent_metadata_queries_by_interval` gets applied, portion of the metadata request that falls in this window is split using `split_recent_metadata_queries_by_interval`. The value 0 disables using a different split interval for recent metadata queries.

This is added to improve cacheability of recent metadata queries. Query split interval also determines the interval used in cache key. The default split interval of 24h is useful for caching long queries, each cache key holding 1 day's results. But metadata queries are often shorter than 24h, to cache them effectively we need a smaller split interval. `recent_metadata_query_window` along with `split_recent_metadata_queries_by_interval` help configure a shorter split interval for recent metadata queries.

Entries.Name: split_instant_metric_queries_by_interval
Entries.FieldDesc: Split instant metric queries by a time interval and execute in parallel. The value 0 disables splitting instant metric queries by time. This also determines how cache keys are chosen when instant metric query result caching is enabled.

Entries.Name: split_ingester_queries_by_interval
Entries.FieldDesc: Interval to use for time-based splitting when a request is within the `query_ingesters_within` window; defaults to `split-queries-by-interval` by setting to 0.

Entries.Name: min_sharding_lookback
Entries.FieldDesc: Limit queries that can be sharded. Queries within the time range of now and now minus this sharding lookback are not sharded. The default value of 0s disables the lookback, causing sharding of all queries at all times.

Entries.Name: max_query_bytes_read
Entries.FieldDesc: Max number of bytes a query can fetch. Enforced in log and metric queries only when TSDB is used. This limit is not enforced on log queries without filters. The default value of 0 disables this limit.

Entries.Name: max_querier_bytes_read
Entries.FieldDesc: Max number of bytes a query can fetch after splitting and sharding. Enforced in log and metric queries only when TSDB is used. This limit is not enforced on log queries without filters. The default value of 0 disables this limit.

Entries.Name: volume_enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: Enable log-volume endpoints.

Entries.Name: volume_max_series
Entries.FieldDesc: The maximum number of aggregated series in a log-volume response

Entries.Name: ruler_max_rules_per_rule_group
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum number of rules per rule group per-tenant. 0 to disable.

Entries.Name: ruler_max_rule_groups_per_tenant
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum number of rule groups per-tenant. 0 to disable.

Entries.Name: ruler_tenant_shard_size
Entries.FieldDesc: The default tenant's shard size when shuffle-sharding is enabled in the ruler. When this setting is specified in the per-tenant overrides, a value of 0 disables shuffle sharding for the tenant.

Entries.Name: ruler_enable_wal_replay
Entries.FieldDesc: Enable WAL replay on ruler startup. Disabling this can reduce memory usage on startup at the cost of not recovering in-memory WAL metrics on restart.

Entries.Name: ruler_remote_write_disabled
Entries.FieldDesc: Disable recording rules remote-write.

Entries.Name: ruler_remote_write_url
Entries.FieldDesc: Deprecated: Use 'ruler_remote_write_config' instead. The URL of the endpoint to send samples to.

Entries.Name: ruler_remote_write_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: Deprecated: Use 'ruler_remote_write_config' instead. Timeout for requests to the remote write endpoint.

Entries.Name: ruler_remote_write_headers
Entries.FieldDesc: Deprecated: Use 'ruler_remote_write_config' instead. Custom HTTP headers to be sent along with each remote write request. Be aware that headers that are set by Loki itself can't be overwritten.

Entries.Name: ruler_remote_write_relabel_configs
Entries.FieldDesc: Deprecated: Use 'ruler_remote_write_config' instead. List of remote write relabel configurations.

Entries.Name: ruler_remote_write_queue_capacity
Entries.FieldDesc: Deprecated: Use 'ruler_remote_write_config' instead. Number of samples to buffer per shard before we block reading of more samples from the WAL. It is recommended to have enough capacity in each shard to buffer several requests to keep throughput up while processing occasional slow remote requests.

Entries.Name: ruler_remote_write_queue_min_shards
Entries.FieldDesc: Deprecated: Use 'ruler_remote_write_config' instead. Minimum number of shards, i.e. amount of concurrency.

Entries.Name: ruler_remote_write_queue_max_shards
Entries.FieldDesc: Deprecated: Use 'ruler_remote_write_config' instead. Maximum number of shards, i.e. amount of concurrency.

Entries.Name: ruler_remote_write_queue_max_samples_per_send
Entries.FieldDesc: Deprecated: Use 'ruler_remote_write_config' instead. Maximum number of samples per send.

Entries.Name: ruler_remote_write_queue_batch_send_deadline
Entries.FieldDesc: Deprecated: Use 'ruler_remote_write_config' instead. Maximum time a sample will wait in buffer.

Entries.Name: ruler_remote_write_queue_min_backoff
Entries.FieldDesc: Deprecated: Use 'ruler_remote_write_config' instead. Initial retry delay. Gets doubled for every retry.

Entries.Name: ruler_remote_write_queue_max_backoff
Entries.FieldDesc: Deprecated: Use 'ruler_remote_write_config' instead. Maximum retry delay.

Entries.Name: ruler_remote_write_queue_retry_on_ratelimit
Entries.FieldDesc: Deprecated: Use 'ruler_remote_write_config' instead. Retry upon receiving a 429 status code from the remote-write storage. This is experimental and might change in the future.

Entries.Name: ruler_remote_write_sigv4_config

Block.Name: ruler_remote_write_sigv4_config
Block.Desc: Deprecated: Use 'ruler_remote_write_config' instead. Configures AWS's Signature Verification 4 signing process to sign every remote write request.

Entries.BlockDesc: Deprecated: Use 'ruler_remote_write_config' instead. Configures AWS's Signature Verification 4 signing process to sign every remote write request.

Entries.Name: ruler_remote_write_config
Entries.FieldDesc: Configures global and per-tenant limits for remote write clients. A map with remote client id as key.

Entries.Name: ruler_remote_evaluation_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: Timeout for a remote rule evaluation. Defaults to the value of 'querier.query-timeout'.

Entries.Name: ruler_remote_evaluation_max_response_size
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum size (in bytes) of the allowable response size from a remote rule evaluation. Set to 0 to allow any response size (default).

Entries.Name: deletion_mode
Entries.FieldDesc: Deletion mode. Can be one of 'disabled', 'filter-only', or 'filter-and-delete'. When set to 'filter-only' or 'filter-and-delete', and if retention_enabled is true, then the log entry deletion API endpoints are available.

Entries.Name: retention_period
Entries.FieldDesc: Retention period to apply to stored data, only applies if retention_enabled is true in the compactor config. As of version 2.8.0, a zero value of 0 or 0s disables retention. In previous releases, Loki did not properly honor a zero value to disable retention and a really large value should be used instead.

Entries.Name: retention_stream
Entries.FieldDesc:
Per-stream retention to apply, if the retention is enabled on the compactor side.
Example:
 retention_stream:
 - selector: '{namespace="dev"}'
 priority: 1
 period: 24h
- selector: '{container="nginx"}'
 priority: 1
 period: 744h
Selector is a Prometheus labels matchers that will apply the 'period' retention only if the stream is matching. In case multiple streams are matching, the highest priority will be picked. If no rule is matched the 'retention_period' is used.

Element.Name: retention_stream
Element.Desc:
Per-stream retention to apply, if the retention is enabled on the compactor side.
Example:
 retention_stream:
 - selector: '{namespace="dev"}'
 priority: 1
 period: 24h
- selector: '{container="nginx"}'
 priority: 1
 period: 744h
Selector is a Prometheus labels matchers that will apply the 'period' retention only if the stream is matching. In case multiple streams are matching, the highest priority will be picked. If no rule is matched the 'retention_period' is used.

Entries.Name: per_tenant_override_config
Entries.FieldDesc: Feature renamed to 'runtime configuration', flag deprecated in favor of -runtime-config.file (runtime_config.file in YAML).

Entries.Name: per_tenant_override_period
Entries.FieldDesc: Feature renamed to 'runtime configuration'; flag deprecated in favor of -runtime-config.reload-period (runtime_config.period in YAML).

Entries.Name: allow_deletes
Entries.FieldDesc: Deprecated: Use deletion_mode per tenant configuration instead.

Entries.Name: shard_streams

Block.Name: shard_streams
Block.Desc: Define streams sharding behavior.

Entries.Name: enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: Automatically shard streams to keep them under the per-stream rate limit. Sharding is dictated by the desired rate.

Entries.Name: time_sharding_enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: Automatically shard streams by adding a __time_shard__ label, with values calculated from the log timestamps divided by MaxChunkAge/2. This allows the out-of-order ingestion of very old logs. If both flags are enabled, time-based sharding will happen before rate-based sharding.

Entries.Name: time_sharding_ignore_recent
Entries.FieldDesc: Logs with timestamps that are newer than this value will not be time-sharded.

Entries.Name: logging_enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: Whether to log sharding streams behavior or not. Not recommended for production environments.

Entries.Name: desired_rate
Entries.FieldDesc: Threshold used to cut a new shard. Default (1536KB) means if a rate is above 1536KB/s, it will be sharded into two streams.

Entries.BlockDesc: Define streams sharding behavior.

Entries.Name: required_labels
Entries.FieldDesc: Define a list of required selector labels.

Entries.Name: minimum_labels_number
Entries.FieldDesc: Minimum number of label matchers a query should contain.

Entries.Name: index_gateway_shard_size
Entries.FieldDesc: The shard size defines how many index gateways should be used by a tenant for querying. If the global shard factor is 0, the global shard factor is set to the deprecated -replication-factor for backwards compatibility reasons.

Entries.Name: bloom_gateway_enable_filtering
Entries.FieldDesc: Experimental. Whether to use the bloom gateway component in the read path to filter chunks.

Entries.Name: bloom_build_max_builders
Entries.FieldDesc: Experimental. Maximum number of builders to use when building blooms. 0 allows unlimited builders.

Entries.Name: bloom_build_task_max_retries
Entries.FieldDesc: Experimental. Maximum number of retries for a failed task. If a task fails more than this number of times, it is considered failed and will not be retried. A value of 0 disables this limit.

Entries.Name: bloom_build_builder_response_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: Experimental. Timeout for a builder to finish a task. If a builder does not respond within this time, it is considered failed and the task will be requeued. 0 disables the timeout.

Entries.Name: bloom_creation_enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: Experimental. Whether to create blooms for the tenant.

Entries.Name: bloom_planning_strategy
Entries.FieldDesc: Experimental. Bloom planning strategy to use in bloom creation. Can be one of: 'split_keyspace_by_factor', 'split_by_series_chunks_size'

Entries.Name: bloom_split_series_keyspace_by
Entries.FieldDesc: Experimental. Only if `bloom-build.planning-strategy` is 'split'. Number of splits to create for the series keyspace when building blooms. The series keyspace is split into this many parts to parallelize bloom creation.

Entries.Name: bloom_task_target_series_chunk_size
Entries.FieldDesc: Experimental. Target chunk size in bytes for bloom tasks. Default is 20GB.

Entries.Name: bloom_block_encoding
Entries.FieldDesc: Experimental. Compression algorithm for bloom block pages.

Entries.Name: bloom_prefetch_blocks
Entries.FieldDesc: Experimental. Prefetch blocks on bloom gateways as soon as they are built.

Entries.Name: bloom_max_block_size
Entries.FieldDesc: Experimental. The maximum bloom block size. A value of 0 sets an unlimited size. Default is 200MB. The actual block size might exceed this limit since blooms will be added to blocks until the block exceeds the maximum block size.

Entries.Name: bloom_max_bloom_size
Entries.FieldDesc: Experimental. The maximum bloom size per log stream. A log stream whose generated bloom filter exceeds this size will be discarded. A value of 0 sets an unlimited size. Default is 128MB.

Entries.Name: allow_structured_metadata
Entries.FieldDesc: Allow user to send structured metadata in push payload.

Entries.Name: max_structured_metadata_size
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum size accepted for structured metadata per log line.

Entries.Name: max_structured_metadata_entries_count
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum number of structured metadata entries per log line.

Entries.Name: otlp_config

Block.Name: otlp_config
Block.Desc: OTLP log ingestion configurations

Entries.Name: resource_attributes

Block.Name: resource_attributes
Block.Desc: Configuration for resource attributes to store them as index labels or Structured Metadata or drop them altogether

Entries.Name: ignore_defaults
Entries.FieldDesc: Configure whether to ignore the default list of resource attributes set in 'distributor.otlp.default_resource_attributes_as_index_labels' to be stored as index labels and only use the given resource attributes config

Entries.BlockDesc: Configuration for resource attributes to store them as index labels or Structured Metadata or drop them altogether

Entries.Name: scope_attributes
Entries.FieldDesc: Configuration for scope attributes to store them as Structured Metadata or drop them altogether

Element.Name: scope_attributes
Element.Desc: Configuration for scope attributes to store them as Structured Metadata or drop them altogether

Entries.Name: log_attributes
Entries.FieldDesc: Configuration for log attributes to store them as index labels or Structured Metadata or drop them altogether

Element.Name: log_attributes
Element.Desc: Configuration for log attributes to store them as index labels or Structured Metadata or drop them altogether

Entries.Name: severity_text_as_label
Entries.FieldDesc: When true, the severity_text field from log records will be stored as an index label. It is recommended not to use this option unless absolutely necessary

Entries.BlockDesc: OTLP log ingestion configurations

Entries.Name: block_ingestion_policy_until
Entries.FieldDesc: Block ingestion for policy until the configured date. The policy '*' is the global policy, which is applied to all streams not matching a policy and can be overridden by other policies. The time should be in RFC3339 format. The policy is based on the policy_stream_mapping configuration.

Entries.Name: block_ingestion_until
Entries.FieldDesc: Block ingestion until the configured date. The time should be in RFC3339 format.

Entries.Name: block_ingestion_status_code
Entries.FieldDesc: HTTP status code to return when ingestion is blocked. If 200, the ingestion will be blocked without returning an error to the client. By Default, a custom status code (260) is returned to the client along with an error message.

Entries.Name: enforced_labels
Entries.FieldDesc: List of labels that must be present in the stream. If any of the labels are missing, the stream will be discarded. This flag configures it globally for all tenants. Experimental.

Entries.Name: policy_enforced_labels
Entries.FieldDesc:
Map of policies to enforced labels. The policy '*' is the global policy, which is applied to all streams and can be extended by other policies. Example:
 policy_enforced_labels: 
  policy1: 
    - label1 
    - label2 
  policy2: 
    - label3 
    - label4
  '*':
    - label5
Entries.FieldType: map of string to list of strings

Entries.Name: policy_stream_mapping
Entries.FieldDesc:
Map of policies to stream selectors with a priority. Experimental.  Example:
 policy_stream_mapping: 
  finance: 
    - selector: '{namespace="prod", container="billing"}' 
      priority: 2 
  ops: 
    - selector: '{namespace="prod", container="ops"}' 
      priority: 1 
  staging: 
    - selector: '{namespace="staging"}' 
      priority: 1
Entries.FieldType: map of string to list of PriorityStreams

Entries.Name: ingestion_partitions_tenant_shard_size
Entries.FieldDesc: The number of partitions a tenant's data should be sharded to when using kafka ingestion. Tenants are sharded across partitions using shuffle-sharding. 0 disables shuffle sharding and tenant is sharded across all partitions.

Entries.Name: shard_aggregations
Entries.FieldDesc: List of LogQL vector and range aggregations that should be sharded.

Entries.Name: metric_aggregation_enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: Enable metric aggregation. When enabled, pushed streams will be sampled for bytes and line counts. These metrics will be written back into Loki as a special __aggregated_metric__ stream.

Entries.Name: pattern_persistence_enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: Enable persistence of patterns detected at ingest. When enabled, patterns for pushed streams will be written back into Loki as a special __pattern__ stream.

Entries.Name: s3_sse_type
Entries.FieldDesc: S3 server-side encryption type. Required to enable server-side encryption overrides for a specific tenant. If not set, the default S3 client settings are used.

Entries.Name: s3_sse_kms_key_id
Entries.FieldDesc: S3 server-side encryption KMS Key ID. Ignored if the SSE type override is not set.

Entries.Name: s3_sse_kms_encryption_context
Entries.FieldDesc: S3 server-side encryption KMS encryption context. If unset and the key ID override is set, the encryption context will not be provided to S3. Ignored if the SSE type override is not set.

Entries.BlockDesc: The limits_config block configures global and per-tenant limits in Loki. The values here can be overridden in the `overrides` section of the runtime_config file

Entries.Name: frontend_worker

Block.Name: frontend_worker
Block.Desc: The frontend_worker configures the worker - running within the Loki querier - picking up and executing queries enqueued by the query-frontend.

Entries.Name: frontend_address
Entries.FieldDesc: Address of query frontend service, in host:port format. If -querier.scheduler-address is set as well, querier will use scheduler instead. Only one of -querier.frontend-address or -querier.scheduler-address can be set. If neither is set, queries are only received via HTTP endpoint.

Entries.Name: scheduler_address
Entries.FieldDesc: Hostname (and port) of scheduler that querier will periodically resolve, connect to and receive queries from. Only one of -querier.frontend-address or -querier.scheduler-address can be set. If neither is set, queries are only received via HTTP endpoint.

Entries.Name: dns_lookup_duration
Entries.FieldDesc: How often to query DNS for query-frontend or query-scheduler address. Also used to determine how often to poll the scheduler-ring for addresses if the scheduler-ring is configured.

Entries.Name: id
Entries.FieldDesc: Querier ID, sent to frontend service to identify requests from the same querier. Defaults to hostname.

Entries.Name: query_frontend_grpc_client

Block.Name: grpc_client
Block.Desc: Configures the querier gRPC client used to communicate with the query-frontend. This can't be used in conjunction with 'grpc_client_config'.

Entries.Name: max_recv_msg_size
Entries.FieldDesc: gRPC client max receive message size (bytes).

Entries.Name: max_send_msg_size
Entries.FieldDesc: gRPC client max send message size (bytes).

Entries.Name: grpc_compression
Entries.FieldDesc: Use compression when sending messages. Supported values are: gzip, snappy, ''

Entries.Name: rate_limit
Entries.FieldDesc: Rate limit for gRPC client; 0 means disabled.

Entries.Name: rate_limit_burst
Entries.FieldDesc: Rate limit burst for gRPC client.

Entries.Name: backoff_on_ratelimits
Entries.FieldDesc: Enable backoff and retry when we hit rate limits.

Entries.Name: min_period
Entries.FieldDesc: Minimum delay when backing off.

Entries.Name: max_period
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum delay when backing off.

Entries.Name: max_retries
Entries.FieldDesc: Number of times to backoff and retry before failing.

Entries.Name: initial_stream_window_size
Entries.FieldDesc: Initial stream window size. Values less than the default are not supported and are ignored. Setting this to a value other than the default disables the BDP estimator.

Entries.Name: initial_connection_window_size
Entries.FieldDesc: Initial connection window size. Values less than the default are not supported and are ignored. Setting this to a value other than the default disables the BDP estimator.

Entries.Name: tls_enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: Enable TLS in the gRPC client. This flag needs to be enabled when any other TLS flag is set. If set to false, insecure connection to gRPC server will be used.

Block.Name: tls_config
Block.Desc: The TLS configuration.

Entries.Name: tls_cert_path
Entries.FieldDesc: Path to the client certificate, which will be used for authenticating with the server. Also requires the key path to be configured.

Entries.Name: tls_key_path
Entries.FieldDesc: Path to the key for the client certificate. Also requires the client certificate to be configured.

Entries.Name: tls_ca_path
Entries.FieldDesc: Path to the CA certificates to validate server certificate against. If not set, the host's root CA certificates are used.

Entries.Name: tls_server_name
Entries.FieldDesc: Override the expected name on the server certificate.

Entries.Name: tls_insecure_skip_verify
Entries.FieldDesc: Skip validating server certificate.

Entries.Name: tls_cipher_suites
Entries.FieldDesc:
Override the default cipher suite list (separated by commas). Allowed values:

Secure Ciphers:
- TLS_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
- TLS_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
- TLS_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA

- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256

- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256

Entries.FieldDesc: Override the default minimum TLS version. Allowed values: VersionTLS10, VersionTLS11, VersionTLS12, VersionTLS13

Entries.Name: table_manager

Block.Name: table_manager
Block.Desc: The table_manager block configures the table manager for retention.

Entries.Name: throughput_updates_disabled
Entries.FieldDesc: If true, disable all changes to DB capacity

Entries.Name: retention_deletes_enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: If true, enables retention deletes of DB tables

Entries.Name: retention_period
Entries.FieldDesc: Tables older than this retention period are deleted. Must be either 0 (disabled) or a multiple of 24h. When enabled, be aware this setting is destructive to data!

Entries.Name: poll_interval
Entries.FieldDesc: How frequently to poll backend to learn our capacity.

Entries.Name: creation_grace_period
Entries.FieldDesc: Periodic tables grace period (duration which table will be created/deleted before/after it's needed).

Entries.Name: enable_ondemand_throughput_mode
Entries.FieldDesc: Enables on demand throughput provisioning for the storage provider (if supported). Applies only to tables which are not autoscaled. Supported by DynamoDB

Entries.Name: provisioned_write_throughput
Entries.FieldDesc: Table default write throughput. Supported by DynamoDB

Entries.Name: provisioned_read_throughput
Entries.FieldDesc: Table default read throughput. Supported by DynamoDB

Entries.Name: enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: Should we enable autoscale for the table.

Entries.Name: role_arn
Entries.FieldDesc: AWS AutoScaling role ARN

Entries.Name: min_capacity
Entries.FieldDesc: DynamoDB minimum provision capacity.

Entries.Name: max_capacity
Entries.FieldDesc: DynamoDB maximum provision capacity.

Entries.Name: out_cooldown
Entries.FieldDesc: DynamoDB minimum seconds between each autoscale up.

Entries.Name: in_cooldown
Entries.FieldDesc: DynamoDB minimum seconds between each autoscale down.

Entries.Name: target
Entries.FieldDesc: DynamoDB target ratio of consumed capacity to provisioned capacity.

Entries.Name: memberlist

Block.Name: memberlist
Block.Desc:
Configuration for memberlist client. Only applies if the selected kvstore is memberlist.

When a memberlist config with atleast 1 join_members is defined, kvstore of type memberlist is automatically selected for all the components that require a ring unless otherwise specified in the component's configuration section.

Entries.Name: node_name
Entries.FieldDesc: Name of the node in memberlist cluster. Defaults to hostname.

Entries.Name: randomize_node_name
Entries.FieldDesc: Add random suffix to the node name.

Entries.Name: stream_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: The timeout for establishing a connection with a remote node, and for read/write operations.

Entries.Name: retransmit_factor
Entries.FieldDesc: Multiplication factor used when sending out messages (factor * log(N+1)).

Entries.Name: pull_push_interval
Entries.FieldDesc: How often to use pull/push sync.

Entries.Name: gossip_interval
Entries.FieldDesc: How often to gossip.

Entries.Name: gossip_nodes
Entries.FieldDesc: How many nodes to gossip to.

Entries.Name: gossip_to_dead_nodes_time
Entries.FieldDesc: How long to keep gossiping to dead nodes, to give them chance to refute their death.

Entries.Name: dead_node_reclaim_time
Entries.FieldDesc: How soon can dead node's name be reclaimed with new address. 0 to disable.

Entries.Name: compression_enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: Enable message compression. This can be used to reduce bandwidth usage at the cost of slightly more CPU utilization.

Entries.Name: notify_interval
Entries.FieldDesc: How frequently to notify watchers when a key changes. Can reduce CPU activity in large memberlist deployments. 0 to notify without delay.

Entries.Name: advertise_addr
Entries.FieldDesc: Gossip address to advertise to other members in the cluster. Used for NAT traversal.

Entries.Name: advertise_port
Entries.FieldDesc: Gossip port to advertise to other members in the cluster. Used for NAT traversal.

Entries.Name: cluster_label
Entries.FieldDesc: The cluster label is an optional string to include in outbound packets and gossip streams. Other members in the memberlist cluster will discard any message whose label doesn't match the configured one, unless the 'cluster-label-verification-disabled' configuration option is set to true.

Entries.Name: cluster_label_verification_disabled
Entries.FieldDesc: When true, memberlist doesn't verify that inbound packets and gossip streams have the cluster label matching the configured one. This verification should be disabled while rolling out the change to the configured cluster label in a live memberlist cluster.

Entries.Name: join_members
Entries.FieldDesc: Other cluster members to join. Can be specified multiple times. It can be an IP, hostname or an entry specified in the DNS Service Discovery format.

Entries.Name: min_join_backoff
Entries.FieldDesc: Min backoff duration to join other cluster members.

Entries.Name: max_join_backoff
Entries.FieldDesc: Max backoff duration to join other cluster members.

Entries.Name: max_join_retries
Entries.FieldDesc: Max number of retries to join other cluster members.

Entries.Name: abort_if_cluster_fast_join_fails
Entries.FieldDesc: Abort if this node fails the fast memberlist cluster joining procedure at startup. When enabled, it's guaranteed that other services, depending on memberlist, have an updated view over the cluster state when they're started.

Entries.Name: abort_if_cluster_join_fails
Entries.FieldDesc: Abort if this node fails to join memberlist cluster at startup. When enabled, it's not guaranteed that other services are started only after the cluster state has been successfully updated; use 'abort-if-fast-join-fails' instead.

Entries.Name: rejoin_interval
Entries.FieldDesc: If not 0, how often to rejoin the cluster. Occasional rejoin can help to fix the cluster split issue, and is harmless otherwise. For example when using only few components as a seed nodes (via -memberlist.join), then it's recommended to use rejoin. If -memberlist.join points to dynamic service that resolves to all gossiping nodes (eg. Kubernetes headless service), then rejoin is not needed.

Entries.Name: left_ingesters_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: How long to keep LEFT ingesters in the ring.

Entries.Name: obsolete_entries_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: How long to keep obsolete entries in the KV store.

Entries.Name: leave_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: Timeout for leaving memberlist cluster.

Entries.Name: broadcast_timeout_for_local_updates_on_shutdown
Entries.FieldDesc: Timeout for broadcasting all remaining locally-generated updates to other nodes when shutting down. Only used if there are nodes left in the memberlist cluster, and only applies to locally-generated updates, not to broadcast messages that are result of incoming gossip updates. 0 = no timeout, wait until all locally-generated updates are sent.

Entries.Name: message_history_buffer_bytes
Entries.FieldDesc: How much space to use for keeping received and sent messages in memory for troubleshooting (two buffers). 0 to disable.

Entries.Name: watch_prefix_buffer_size
Entries.FieldDesc: Size of the buffered channel for the WatchPrefix function.

Entries.Name: bind_addr
Entries.FieldDesc: IP address to listen on for gossip messages. Multiple addresses may be specified. Defaults to 0.0.0.0

Entries.Name: bind_port
Entries.FieldDesc: Port to listen on for gossip messages.

Entries.Name: packet_dial_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: Timeout used when connecting to other nodes to send packet.

Entries.Name: packet_write_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: Timeout for writing 'packet' data.

Entries.Name: max_concurrent_writes
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum number of concurrent writes to other nodes.

Entries.Name: acquire_writer_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: Timeout for acquiring one of the concurrent write slots. After this time, the message will be dropped.

Entries.Name: tls_enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: Enable TLS on the memberlist transport layer.

Block.Name: tls_config
Block.Desc: The TLS configuration.

Entries.Name: tls_cert_path
Entries.FieldDesc: Path to the client certificate, which will be used for authenticating with the server. Also requires the key path to be configured.

Entries.Name: tls_key_path
Entries.FieldDesc: Path to the key for the client certificate. Also requires the client certificate to be configured.

Entries.Name: tls_ca_path
Entries.FieldDesc: Path to the CA certificates to validate server certificate against. If not set, the host's root CA certificates are used.

Entries.Name: tls_server_name
Entries.FieldDesc: Override the expected name on the server certificate.

Entries.Name: tls_insecure_skip_verify
Entries.FieldDesc: Skip validating server certificate.

Entries.Name: tls_cipher_suites
Entries.FieldDesc:
Override the default cipher suite list (separated by commas). Allowed values:

Secure Ciphers:
- TLS_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
- TLS_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
- TLS_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256

Insecure Ciphers:
- TLS_RSA_WITH_RC4_128_SHA
- TLS_RSA_WITH_3DES_EDE_CBC_SHA
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_RC4_128_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_RC4_128_SHA
