- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256

Entries.Name: tls_min_version
Entries.FieldDesc: Override the default minimum TLS version. Allowed values: VersionTLS10, VersionTLS11, VersionTLS12, VersionTLS13

Entries.BlockDesc: The TLS configuration.

Configuration for memberlist client. Only applies if the selected kvstore is memberlist.

When a memberlist config with atleast 1 join_members is defined, kvstore of type memberlist is automatically selected for all the components that require a ring unless otherwise specified in the component's configuration section.

Entries.Name: topic
Entries.FieldDesc: The Kafka topic name.

Entries.Name: dial_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: The maximum time allowed to open a connection to a Kafka broker.

Entries.Name: write_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: How long to wait for an incoming write request to be successfully committed to the Kafka backend.

Entries.Name: address
Entries.FieldDesc: The Kafka backend address.

Entries.Name: client_id
Entries.FieldDesc: The Kafka client ID.

Entries.Name: address
Entries.FieldDesc: The Kafka backend address.

Entries.Name: client_id
Entries.FieldDesc: The Kafka client ID.

Entries.Name: sasl_username
Entries.FieldDesc: The SASL username for authentication to Kafka using the PLAIN mechanism. Both username and password must be set.

Entries.Name: sasl_password
Entries.FieldDesc: The SASL password for authentication to Kafka using the PLAIN mechanism. Both username and password must be set.

Entries.Name: consumer_group
Entries.FieldDesc: The consumer group used by the consumer to track the last consumed offset. The consumer group must be different for each ingester zone.When empty, Loki uses the ingester instance ID.

Entries.Name: consumer_group_offset_commit_interval
Entries.FieldDesc: How frequently a consumer should commit the consumed offset to Kafka. The last committed offset is used at startup to continue the consumption from where it was left.

Entries.Name: last_produced_offset_retry_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: How long to retry a failed request to get the last produced offset.

Entries.Name: auto_create_topic_enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: Enable auto-creation of Kafka topic if it doesn't exist.

Entries.Name: auto_create_topic_default_partitions
Entries.FieldDesc: When auto-creation of Kafka topic is enabled and this value is positive, Kafka's num.partitions configuration option is set on Kafka brokers with this value when Loki component that uses Kafka starts. This configuration option specifies the default number of partitions that the Kafka broker uses for auto-created topics. Note that this is a Kafka-cluster wide setting, and applies to any auto-created topic. If the setting of num.partitions fails, Loki proceeds anyways, but auto-created topics could have an incorrect number of partitions.

Entries.Name: producer_max_record_size_bytes
Entries.FieldDesc: The maximum size of a Kafka record data that should be generated by the producer. An incoming write request larger than this size is split into multiple Kafka records. We strongly recommend to not change this setting unless for testing purposes.

Entries.Name: producer_max_buffered_bytes
Entries.FieldDesc: The maximum size of (uncompressed) buffered and unacknowledged produced records sent to Kafka. The produce request fails once this limit is reached. This limit is per Kafka client. 0 to disable the limit.

Entries.Name: max_consumer_lag_at_startup
Entries.FieldDesc: The guaranteed maximum lag before a consumer is considered to have caught up reading from a partition at startup, becomes ACTIVE in the hash ring and passes the readiness check. Set -kafka.max-consumer-lag-at-startup to 0 to disable waiting for maximum consumer lag being honored at startup.

Entries.Name: max_consumer_workers
Entries.FieldDesc: The maximum number of workers to use for processing records from Kafka.

Entries.Name: enable_kafka_histograms
Entries.FieldDesc: Enable collection of the following kafka latency histograms: read-wait, read-timing, write-wait, write-timing

Entries.Name: target_page_size
Entries.FieldDesc: The size of the target page to use for the data object builder.

Entries.Name: target_object_size
Entries.FieldDesc: The size of the target object to use for the data object builder.

Entries.Name: target_section_size
Entries.FieldDesc: Configures a maximum size for sections, for sections that support it.

Entries.Name: buffer_size
Entries.FieldDesc: The size of the buffer to use for sorting logs.

Entries.Name: section_stripe_merge_limit
Entries.FieldDesc: The maximum number of stripes to merge into a section at once. Must be greater than 1.

Entries.Name: shaprefixsize
Entries.FieldDesc: The size of the SHA prefix to use for generating object storage keys for data objects.

Entries.Name: idle_flush_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: The maximum amount of time to wait in seconds before flushing an object that is no longer receiving new writes

Entries.Name: enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: Enable the dataobj querier.

Entries.Name: from
Entries.FieldDesc: The date of the first day of when the dataobj querier should start querying from. In YYYY-MM-DD format, for example: 2018-04-15.

Entries.Name: shard_factor
Entries.FieldDesc: The number of shards to use for the dataobj querier.

Entries.Name: storage_bucket_prefix
Entries.FieldDesc: The prefix to use for the storage bucket.

Entries.Name: enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: Enable the ingest limits service.

Entries.Name: active_window
Entries.FieldDesc: The duration for which which streams are considered active. Streams that have not been updated within this window are considered inactive and not counted towards limits.

Entries.Name: rate_window
Entries.FieldDesc: The time window for rate calculation. This should match the window used in Prometheus rate() queries for consistency.

Entries.Name: bucket_size
Entries.FieldDesc: The size of the buckets used to calculate stream rates. Smaller buckets provide more precise rates but require more memory.

Entries.Name: eviction_interval
Entries.FieldDesc: The interval at which old streams are evicted.

Entries.Name: num_partitions
Entries.FieldDesc: The number of partitions for the Kafka topic used to read and write stream metadata. It is fixed, not a maximum.

Entries.Name: store
Entries.FieldDesc: Backend storage to use for the ring. Supported values are: consul, etcd, inmemory, memberlist, multi.

Entries.Name: prefix
Entries.FieldDesc: The prefix for the keys in the store. Should end with a /.

Entries.Name: consul

Block.Name: consul
Block.Desc: Configuration for a Consul client. Only applies if the selected kvstore is consul.

Entries.Name: host
Entries.FieldDesc: Hostname and port of Consul.

Entries.Name: acl_token
Entries.FieldDesc: ACL Token used to interact with Consul.

Entries.Name: http_client_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: HTTP timeout when talking to Consul

Entries.Name: consistent_reads
Entries.FieldDesc: Enable consistent reads to Consul.

Entries.Name: watch_rate_limit
Entries.FieldDesc: Rate limit when watching key or prefix in Consul, in requests per second. 0 disables the rate limit.

Entries.Name: watch_burst_size
Entries.FieldDesc: Burst size used in rate limit. Values less than 1 are treated as 1.

Entries.Name: cas_retry_delay
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum duration to wait before retrying a Compare And Swap (CAS) operation.

Entries.BlockDesc: Configuration for a Consul client. Only applies if the selected kvstore is consul.

Entries.Name: username
Entries.FieldDesc: Etcd username.

Entries.Name: password
Entries.FieldDesc: Etcd password.

Entries.BlockDesc: Configuration for an ETCD v3 client. Only applies if the selected kvstore is etcd.

Entries.Name: primary
Entries.FieldDesc: Primary backend storage used by multi-client.

Entries.Name: secondary
Entries.FieldDesc: Secondary backend storage used by multi-client.

Entries.Name: mirror_enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: Mirror writes to secondary store.

Entries.Name: mirror_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: Timeout for storing value to secondary store.

Entries.Name: heartbeat_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: The heartbeat timeout after which ingesters are skipped for reads/writes. 0 = never (timeout disabled).

Entries.Name: replication_factor
Entries.FieldDesc: The number of ingesters to write to and read from.

Entries.Name: zone_awareness_enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: True to enable the zone-awareness and replicate ingested samples across different availability zones.

Entries.Name: excluded_zones
Entries.FieldDesc: Comma-separated list of zones to exclude from the ring. Instances in excluded zones will be filtered out from the ring.

Entries.Name: num_tokens
Entries.FieldDesc: Number of tokens for each ingester.

Entries.Name: heartbeat_period
Entries.FieldDesc: Period at which to heartbeat to consul. 0 = disabled.

Entries.Name: heartbeat_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: Heartbeat timeout after which instance is assumed to be unhealthy. 0 = disabled.

Entries.Name: observe_period
Entries.FieldDesc: Observe tokens after generating to resolve collisions. Useful when using gossiping ring.

Entries.Name: join_after
Entries.FieldDesc: Period to wait for a claim from another member; will join automatically after this.

Entries.Name: min_ready_duration
Entries.FieldDesc: Minimum duration to wait after the internal readiness checks have passed but before succeeding the readiness endpoint. This is used to slowdown deployment controllers (eg. Kubernetes) after an instance is ready and before they proceed with a rolling update, to give the rest of the cluster instances enough time to receive ring updates.

Entries.Name: interface_names
Entries.FieldDesc: Name of network interface to read address from.

Entries.Name: enable_inet6
Entries.FieldDesc: Enable IPv6 support. Required to make use of IP addresses from IPv6 interfaces.

Entries.Name: final_sleep
Entries.FieldDesc: Duration to sleep for before exiting, to ensure metrics are scraped.

Entries.Name: tokens_file_path
Entries.FieldDesc: File path where tokens are stored. If empty, tokens are not stored at shutdown and restored at startup.

Entries.Name: availability_zone
Entries.FieldDesc: The availability zone where this instance is running.

Entries.Name: unregister_on_shutdown
Entries.FieldDesc: Unregister from the ring upon clean shutdown. It can be useful to disable for rolling restarts with consistent naming in conjunction with -distributor.extend-writes=false.

Entries.Name: readiness_check_ring_health
Entries.FieldDesc: When enabled the readiness probe succeeds only after all instances are ACTIVE and healthy in the ring, otherwise only the instance itself is checked. This option should be disabled if in your cluster multiple instances can be rolled out simultaneously, otherwise rolling updates may be slowed down.

Entries.Name: address
Entries.FieldDesc: IP address to advertise in the ring.

Entries.Name: port
Entries.FieldDesc: port to advertise in consul (defaults to server.grpc-listen-port).

Entries.Name: id
Entries.FieldDesc: ID to register in the ring.

Entries.Name: consumer_group
Entries.FieldDesc: The consumer group for the Kafka topic used to read stream metadata records.

Entries.Name: topic
Entries.FieldDesc: The topic for the Kafka topic used to read and write stream metadata records.

Entries.Name: grpc_client_config

Block.Name: grpc_client
Block.Desc: Configures client gRPC connections to limits service.

Entries.Name: max_recv_msg_size
Entries.FieldDesc: gRPC client max receive message size (bytes).

Entries.Name: max_send_msg_size
Entries.FieldDesc: gRPC client max send message size (bytes).

Entries.Name: grpc_compression
Entries.FieldDesc: Use compression when sending messages. Supported values are: gzip, snappy, ''

Entries.Name: rate_limit
Entries.FieldDesc: Rate limit for gRPC client; 0 means disabled.

Entries.Name: rate_limit_burst
Entries.FieldDesc: Rate limit burst for gRPC client.

Entries.Name: backoff_on_ratelimits
Entries.FieldDesc: Enable backoff and retry when we hit rate limits.

Entries.Name: min_period
Entries.FieldDesc: Minimum delay when backing off.

Entries.Name: max_period
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum delay when backing off.

Entries.Name: max_retries
Entries.FieldDesc: Number of times to backoff and retry before failing.

Entries.Name: initial_stream_window_size
Entries.FieldDesc: Initial stream window size. Values less than the default are not supported and are ignored. Setting this to a value other than the default disables the BDP estimator.

Entries.Name: initial_connection_window_size
Entries.FieldDesc: Initial connection window size. Values less than the default are not supported and are ignored. Setting this to a value other than the default disables the BDP estimator.

Entries.Name: tls_enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: Enable TLS in the gRPC client. This flag needs to be enabled when any other TLS flag is set. If set to false, insecure connection to gRPC server will be used.

Entries.BlockDesc: The TLS configuration.

Entries.Name: username
Entries.FieldDesc: Etcd username.

Entries.Name: password
Entries.FieldDesc: Etcd password.

Entries.BlockDesc: Configuration for an ETCD v3 client. Only applies if the selected kvstore is etcd.

Entries.Name: primary
Entries.FieldDesc: Primary backend storage used by multi-client.

Entries.Name: secondary
Entries.FieldDesc: Secondary backend storage used by multi-client.

Entries.Name: mirror_enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: Mirror writes to secondary store.

Entries.Name: mirror_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: Timeout for storing value to secondary store.

Entries.Name: heartbeat_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: The heartbeat timeout after which ingesters are skipped for reads/writes. 0 = never (timeout disabled).

Entries.Name: replication_factor
Entries.FieldDesc: The number of ingesters to write to and read from.

Entries.Name: zone_awareness_enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: True to enable the zone-awareness and replicate ingested samples across different availability zones.

Entries.Name: excluded_zones
Entries.FieldDesc: Comma-separated list of zones to exclude from the ring. Instances in excluded zones will be filtered out from the ring.

Entries.Name: num_tokens
Entries.FieldDesc: Number of tokens for each ingester.

Entries.Name: heartbeat_period
Entries.FieldDesc: Period at which to heartbeat to consul. 0 = disabled.

Entries.Name: heartbeat_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: Heartbeat timeout after which instance is assumed to be unhealthy. 0 = disabled.

Entries.Name: observe_period
Entries.FieldDesc: Observe tokens after generating to resolve collisions. Useful when using gossiping ring.

Entries.Name: join_after
Entries.FieldDesc: Period to wait for a claim from another member; will join automatically after this.

Entries.Name: min_ready_duration
Entries.FieldDesc: Minimum duration to wait after the internal readiness checks have passed but before succeeding the readiness endpoint. This is used to slowdown deployment controllers (eg. Kubernetes) after an instance is ready and before they proceed with a rolling update, to give the rest of the cluster instances enough time to receive ring updates.

Entries.Name: interface_names
Entries.FieldDesc: Name of network interface to read address from.

Entries.Name: enable_inet6
Entries.FieldDesc: Enable IPv6 support. Required to make use of IP addresses from IPv6 interfaces.

Entries.Name: final_sleep
Entries.FieldDesc: Duration to sleep for before exiting, to ensure metrics are scraped.

Entries.Name: tokens_file_path
Entries.FieldDesc: File path where tokens are stored. If empty, tokens are not stored at shutdown and restored at startup.

Entries.Name: availability_zone
Entries.FieldDesc: The availability zone where this instance is running.

Entries.Name: unregister_on_shutdown
Entries.FieldDesc: Unregister from the ring upon clean shutdown. It can be useful to disable for rolling restarts with consistent naming in conjunction with -distributor.extend-writes=false.

Entries.Name: readiness_check_ring_health
Entries.FieldDesc: When enabled the readiness probe succeeds only after all instances are ACTIVE and healthy in the ring, otherwise only the instance itself is checked. This option should be disabled if in your cluster multiple instances can be rolled out simultaneously, otherwise rolling updates may be slowed down.

Entries.Name: address
Entries.FieldDesc: IP address to advertise in the ring.

Entries.Name: port
Entries.FieldDesc: port to advertise in consul (defaults to server.grpc-listen-port).

Entries.Name: id
Entries.FieldDesc: ID to register in the ring.

Entries.Name: num_partitions
Entries.FieldDesc: The number of partitions to use for the ring.

Entries.Name: assigned_partitions_cache_ttl
Entries.FieldDesc: The TTL for the assigned partitions cache. 0 disables the cache.

Entries.Name: grpc_client_config

Block.Name: grpc_client
Block.Desc: Configures client gRPC connections to limits service.

Entries.Name: max_recv_msg_size
Entries.FieldDesc: gRPC client max receive message size (bytes).

Entries.Name: max_send_msg_size
Entries.FieldDesc: gRPC client max send message size (bytes).

Entries.Name: grpc_compression
Entries.FieldDesc: Use compression when sending messages. Supported values are: gzip, snappy, ''

Entries.Name: rate_limit
Entries.FieldDesc: Rate limit for gRPC client; 0 means disabled.

Entries.Name: rate_limit_burst
Entries.FieldDesc: Rate limit burst for gRPC client.

Entries.Name: backoff_on_ratelimits
Entries.FieldDesc: Enable backoff and retry when we hit rate limits.

Entries.Name: min_period
Entries.FieldDesc: Minimum delay when backing off.

Entries.Name: max_period
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum delay when backing off.

Entries.Name: max_retries
Entries.FieldDesc: Number of times to backoff and retry before failing.

Entries.Name: initial_stream_window_size
Entries.FieldDesc: Initial stream window size. Values less than the default are not supported and are ignored. Setting this to a value other than the default disables the BDP estimator.

Entries.Name: initial_connection_window_size
Entries.FieldDesc: Initial connection window size. Values less than the default are not supported and are ignored. Setting this to a value other than the default disables the BDP estimator.

Entries.Name: tls_enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: Enable TLS in the gRPC client. This flag needs to be enabled when any other TLS flag is set. If set to false, insecure connection to gRPC server will be used.

Block.Name: tls_config
Block.Desc: The TLS configuration.

Entries.Name: tls_cert_path
Entries.FieldDesc: Path to the client certificate, which will be used for authenticating with the server. Also requires the key path to be configured.

Entries.Name: tls_key_path
Entries.FieldDesc: Path to the key for the client certificate. Also requires the client certificate to be configured.

Entries.Name: tls_ca_path
Entries.FieldDesc: Path to the CA certificates to validate server certificate against. If not set, the host's root CA certificates are used.

Entries.Name: tls_server_name
Entries.FieldDesc: Override the expected name on the server certificate.

Entries.Name: tls_insecure_skip_verify
Entries.FieldDesc: Skip validating server certificate.

Entries.Name: tls_cipher_suites
Entries.FieldDesc:
Override the default cipher suite list (separated by commas). Allowed values:

Secure Ciphers:
- TLS_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
- TLS_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
- TLS_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384

- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256

Insecure Ciphers:
- TLS_RSA_WITH_RC4_128_SHA
- TLS_RSA_WITH_3DES_EDE_CBC_SHA

- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256

- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256

Entries.Name: tls_min_version
Entries.FieldDesc: Override the default minimum TLS version. Allowed values: VersionTLS10, VersionTLS11, VersionTLS12, VersionTLS13

Entries.BlockDesc: The TLS configuration.

Entries.Name: connect_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: The maximum amount of time to establish a connection. A value of 0 means default gRPC client connect timeout and backoff.

Entries.Name: connect_backoff_base_delay
Entries.FieldDesc: Initial backoff delay after first connection failure. Only relevant if ConnectTimeout > 0.

Entries.Name: connect_backoff_max_delay
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum backoff delay when establishing a connection. Only relevant if ConnectTimeout > 0.

Entries.Name: label
Entries.FieldDesc: Optionally define the cluster validation label.

Entries.BlockDesc: Configures client gRPC connections to limits service.

Block.Desc: Configures client gRPC connections pool to limits service.

Entries.Name: client_cleanup_period
Entries.FieldDesc: How frequently to clean up clients for ingest-limits-frontend that have gone away.

Entries.Name: health_check_ingest_limits
Entries.FieldDesc: Run a health check on each ingest-limits-frontend client during periodic cleanup.

Entries.Name: remote_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: Timeout for the health check.

Block.Name: runtime_config
Block.Desc: Configuration for 'runtime config' module, responsible for reloading runtime configuration file.

Entries.Name: period
Entries.FieldDesc: How often to check runtime config files.

Entries.Name: file
Entries.FieldDesc: Comma separated list of yaml files with the configuration that can be updated at runtime. Runtime config files will be merged from left to right.

Entries.BlockDesc: Configuration for 'runtime config' module, responsible for reloading runtime configuration file.

Entries.Name: operational_config

Block.Name: operational_config
Block.Desc: These are values which allow you to control aspects of Loki's operation, most commonly used for controlling types of higher verbosity logging, the values here can be overridden in the `configs` section of the `runtime_config` file.

Entries.Name: log_stream_creation
Entries.FieldDesc: Log every new stream created by a push request (very verbose, recommend to enable via runtime config only).

Entries.Name: log_push_request
Entries.FieldDesc: Log every push request (very verbose, recommend to enable via runtime config only).

Entries.Name: log_hash_of_labels
Entries.FieldDesc: Log a commutative hash of the labels for all streams in a push request. In some cases this can potentially be used as an identifier of the agent sending the stream. Calculating hashes is epensive so only enable as needed.

Entries.Name: log_push_request_streams
Entries.FieldDesc: Log every stream in a push request (very verbose, recommend to enable via runtime config only).

Entries.Name: filter_push_request_streams_ips
Entries.FieldDesc: Only show streams that match a provided IP address, LogPushRequestStreams must be enabled. Can be used multiple times to filter by multiple IPs.

Entries.Name: log_service_name_discovery
Entries.FieldDesc: Log service name discovery (very verbose, recommend to enable via runtime config only).

Entries.Name: log_duplicate_metrics
Entries.FieldDesc: Log metrics for duplicate lines received.

Entries.Name: log_duplicate_stream_info
Entries.FieldDesc: Log stream info for duplicate lines received

Entries.Name: limited_log_push_errors
Entries.FieldDesc: Log push errors with a rate limited logger, will show client push errors without overly spamming logs.

Entries.BlockDesc: These are values which allow you to control aspects of Loki's operation, most commonly used for controlling types of higher verbosity logging, the values here can be overridden in the `configs` section of the `runtime_config` file.

Entries.Name: path_prefix
Entries.FieldDesc: prefix for the path

Entries.Name: s3

Block.Name: s3_storage_config
Block.Desc: The s3_storage_config block configures the connection to Amazon S3 object storage backend.

Entries.Name: s3
Entries.FieldDesc: S3 endpoint URL with escaped Key and Secret encoded. If only region is specified as a host, proper endpoint will be deduced. Use inmemory:///<bucket-name> to use a mock in-memory implementation.

Entries.Name: s3forcepathstyle
Entries.FieldDesc: Set this to `true` to force the request to use path-style addressing.

Entries.Name: bucketnames
Entries.FieldDesc: Comma separated list of bucket names to evenly distribute chunks over. Overrides any buckets specified in s3.url flag

Entries.Name: endpoint
Entries.FieldDesc: S3 Endpoint to connect to.

Entries.Name: region
Entries.FieldDesc: AWS region to use.

Entries.Name: access_key_id
Entries.FieldDesc: AWS Access Key ID

Entries.Name: secret_access_key
Entries.FieldDesc: AWS Secret Access Key

Entries.Name: session_token
Entries.FieldDesc: AWS Session Token

Entries.Name: insecure
Entries.FieldDesc: Disable https on s3 connection.

Entries.Name: chunk_delimiter
Entries.FieldDesc: Delimiter used to replace the default delimiter ':' in chunk IDs when storing chunks. This is mainly intended when you run a MinIO instance on a Windows machine. You should not change this value inflight.

Entries.Name: timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: Timeout specifies a time limit for requests made by s3 Client.

Entries.Name: idle_conn_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: The maximum amount of time an idle connection will be held open.

Entries.Name: response_header_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: If non-zero, specifies the amount of time to wait for a server's response headers after fully writing the request.

Entries.Name: insecure_skip_verify
Entries.FieldDesc: Set to true to skip verifying the certificate chain and hostname.

Entries.Name: ca_file
Entries.FieldDesc: Path to the trusted CA file that signed the SSL certificate of the S3 endpoint.

Entries.Name: signature_version
Entries.FieldDesc: The signature version to use for authenticating against S3. Supported values are: v4.

Entries.Name: storage_class
Entries.FieldDesc: The S3 storage class which objects will use. Supported values are: GLACIER, DEEP_ARCHIVE, GLACIER_IR, INTELLIGENT_TIERING, ONEZONE_IA, OUTPOSTS, REDUCED_REDUNDANCY, STANDARD, STANDARD_IA.

Entries.Name: type
Entries.FieldDesc: Enable AWS Server Side Encryption. Supported values: SSE-KMS, SSE-S3.

Entries.Name: kms_key_id
Entries.FieldDesc: KMS Key ID used to encrypt objects in S3

Entries.Name: kms_encryption_context
Entries.FieldDesc: KMS Encryption Context used for object encryption. It expects JSON formatted string.

Entries.Name: backoff_config

Block.Name: backoff_config
Block.Desc: Configures back off when S3 get Object.

Entries.Name: min_period
Entries.FieldDesc: Minimum backoff time when s3 get Object

Entries.Name: max_period
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum backoff time when s3 get Object

Entries.Name: max_retries
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum number of times to retry for s3 GetObject or ObjectExists

Entries.BlockDesc: Configures back off when S3 get Object.

Entries.Name: disable_dualstack
Entries.FieldDesc: Disable forcing S3 dualstack endpoint usage.

Entries.BlockDesc: The s3_storage_config block configures the connection to Amazon S3 object storage backend.

Entries.Name: gcs

Block.Name: gcs_storage_config
Block.Desc: The gcs_storage_config block configures the connection to Google Cloud Storage object storage backend.

Entries.Name: bucket_name
Entries.FieldDesc: Name of GCS bucket. Please refer to https://cloud.google.com/docs/authentication/production for more information about how to configure authentication.

Entries.Name: endpoint
Entries.FieldDesc: Custom GCS endpoint URL.

Entries.Name: service_account
Entries.FieldDesc: Service account key content in JSON format, refer to https://cloud.google.com/iam/docs/creating-managing-service-account-keys for creation.

Entries.Name: chunk_buffer_size
Entries.FieldDesc: The size of the buffer that GCS client for each PUT request. 0 to disable buffering.

Entries.Name: request_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: The duration after which the requests to GCS should be timed out.

Entries.Name: enable_opencensus
Entries.FieldDesc: Enable OpenCensus (OC) instrumentation for all requests.

Entries.Name: enable_http2
Entries.FieldDesc: Enable HTTP2 connections.

Entries.Name: enable_retries
Entries.FieldDesc: Enable automatic retries of failed idempotent requests.

Entries.BlockDesc: The gcs_storage_config block configures the connection to Google Cloud Storage object storage backend.

Entries.Name: azure

Block.Name: azure_storage_config
Block.Desc: The azure_storage_config block configures the connection to Azure object storage backend.

Entries.Name: environment
Entries.FieldDesc: Azure Cloud environment. Supported values are: AzureGlobal, AzureChinaCloud, AzureGermanCloud, AzureUSGovernment.

Entries.Name: account_name
Entries.FieldDesc: Azure storage account name.

Entries.Name: account_key
Entries.FieldDesc: Azure storage account key.

Entries.Name: connection_string
Entries.FieldDesc: If `connection-string` is set, the values of `account-name` and `endpoint-suffix` values will not be used. Use this method over `account-key` if you need to authenticate via a SAS token. Or if you use the Azurite emulator.

Entries.Name: container_name
Entries.FieldDesc: Name of the storage account blob container used to store chunks. This container must be created before running cortex.

Entries.Name: endpoint_suffix
Entries.FieldDesc: Azure storage endpoint suffix without schema. The storage account name will be prefixed to this value to create the FQDN.

Entries.Name: use_managed_identity
Entries.FieldDesc: Use Managed Identity to authenticate to the Azure storage account.

Entries.Name: use_federated_token
Entries.FieldDesc: Use Federated Token to authenticate to the Azure storage account.

Entries.Name: user_assigned_id
Entries.FieldDesc: User assigned identity ID to authenticate to the Azure storage account.

Entries.Name: use_service_principal
Entries.FieldDesc: Use Service Principal to authenticate through Azure OAuth.

Entries.Name: client_id
Entries.FieldDesc: Azure Service Principal ID(GUID).

Entries.Name: client_secret
Entries.FieldDesc: Azure Service Principal secret key.

Entries.Name: tenant_id
Entries.FieldDesc: Azure Tenant ID is used to authenticate through Azure OAuth.

Entries.Name: chunk_delimiter
Entries.FieldDesc: Chunk delimiter for blob ID to be used

Entries.Name: download_buffer_size
Entries.FieldDesc: Preallocated buffer size for downloads.

Entries.Name: upload_buffer_size
Entries.FieldDesc: Preallocated buffer size for uploads.

Entries.Name: upload_buffer_count
Entries.FieldDesc: Number of buffers used to used to upload a chunk.

Entries.Name: request_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: Timeout for requests made against azure blob storage.

Entries.Name: max_retries
Entries.FieldDesc: Number of retries for a request which times out.

Entries.Name: min_retry_delay
Entries.FieldDesc: Minimum time to wait before retrying a request.

Entries.Name: max_retry_delay
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum time to wait before retrying a request.

Entries.BlockDesc: The azure_storage_config block configures the connection to Azure object storage backend.

Entries.Name: auth_version

Entries.Name: auth_url
Entries.FieldDesc: OpenStack Swift authentication URL

Entries.Name: internal
Entries.FieldDesc: Set this to true to use the internal OpenStack Swift endpoint URL

Entries.Name: username
Entries.FieldDesc: OpenStack Swift username.

Entries.Name: user_domain_name
Entries.FieldDesc: OpenStack Swift user's domain name.

Entries.Name: user_domain_id
Entries.FieldDesc: OpenStack Swift user's domain ID.

Entries.Name: user_id
Entries.FieldDesc: OpenStack Swift user ID.

Entries.Name: password

Entries.Name: domain_id
Entries.FieldDesc: OpenStack Swift user's domain ID.

Entries.Name: domain_name
Entries.FieldDesc: OpenStack Swift user's domain name.

Entries.Name: project_id
Entries.FieldDesc: OpenStack Swift project ID (v2,v3 auth only).

Entries.Name: project_name
Entries.FieldDesc: OpenStack Swift project name (v2,v3 auth only).

Entries.Name: project_domain_id
Entries.FieldDesc: ID of the OpenStack Swift project's domain (v3 auth only), only needed if it differs the from user domain.

Entries.Name: project_domain_name
Entries.FieldDesc: Name of the OpenStack Swift project's domain (v3 auth only), only needed if it differs from the user domain.

Entries.Name: region_name
Entries.FieldDesc: OpenStack Swift Region to use (v2,v3 auth only).

Entries.Name: container_name
Entries.FieldDesc: Name of the OpenStack Swift container to put chunks in.

Entries.Name: max_retries
Entries.FieldDesc: Max retries on requests error.

Entries.Name: connect_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: Time after which a connection attempt is aborted.

Entries.Name: request_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: Time after which an idle request is aborted. The timeout watchdog is reset each time some data is received, so the timeout triggers after X time no data is received on a request.

Entries.Name: tls_ca_path
Entries.FieldDesc: Path to the CA certificates to validate server certificate against. If not set, the host's root CA certificates are used.

Entries.FieldDesc: Congestion control strategy to use (default: none, options: 'aimd').

Entries.Name: start
Entries.FieldDesc: AIMD starting throughput window size: how many requests can be sent per second (default: 2000).

Entries.Name: upper_bound
Entries.FieldDesc: AIMD maximum throughput window size: upper limit of requests sent per second (default: 10000).

Entries.Name: backoff_factor
Entries.FieldDesc: AIMD backoff factor when upstream service is throttled to decrease number of requests sent per second (default: 0.5).

Entries.Name: strategy
Entries.FieldDesc: Congestion control retry strategy to use (default: none, options: 'limited').

Entries.Name: limit
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum number of retries allowed.

Entries.Name: strategy
Entries.FieldDesc: Congestion control hedge strategy to use (default: none, options: 'limited').

Entries.Name: object_store

Block.Name: thanos_object_store_config
Block.Desc:
The thanos_object_store_config block configures the connection to object storage backend using thanos-io/objstore clients. This will become the default way of configuring object store clients in future releases.
Currently this is opt-in and takes effect only when `-use-thanos-objstore` is set to true.

Entries.Name: endpoint
Entries.FieldDesc: The S3 bucket endpoint. It could be an AWS S3 endpoint listed at https://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/s3.html or the address of an S3-compatible service in hostname:port format.

Entries.Name: region
Entries.FieldDesc: S3 region. If unset, the client will issue a S3 GetBucketLocation API call to autodetect it.

Entries.Name: bucket_name
Entries.FieldDesc: S3 bucket name

Entries.Name: secret_access_key
Entries.FieldDesc: S3 secret access key

Entries.Name: access_key_id
Entries.FieldDesc: S3 access key ID

Entries.Name: session_token
Entries.FieldDesc: S3 session token

Entries.Name: insecure
Entries.FieldDesc: If enabled, use http:// for the S3 endpoint instead of https://. This could be useful in local dev/test environments while using an S3-compatible backend storage, like Minio.

Entries.Name: list_objects_version
Entries.FieldDesc: Use a specific version of the S3 list object API. Supported values are v1 or v2. Default is unset.

Entries.Name: bucket_lookup_type
Entries.FieldDesc: Bucket lookup style type, used to access bucket in S3-compatible service. Default is auto. Supported values are: auto, path, virtual-hosted.

Entries.Name: dualstack_enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: When enabled, direct all AWS S3 requests to the dual-stack IPv4/IPv6 endpoint for the configured region.

Entries.Name: storage_class
Entries.FieldDesc: The S3 storage class to use, not set by default. Details can be found at https://aws.amazon.com/s3/storage-classes/. Supported values are: STANDARD, REDUCED_REDUNDANCY, GLACIER, STANDARD_IA, ONEZONE_IA, INTELLIGENT_TIERING, DEEP_ARCHIVE, OUTPOSTS, GLACIER_IR, SNOW, EXPRESS_ONEZONE

Entries.Name: native_aws_auth_enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: If enabled, it will use the default authentication methods of the AWS SDK for go based on known environment variables and known AWS config files.

Entries.Name: part_size
Entries.FieldDesc: The minimum file size in bytes used for multipart uploads. If 0, the value is optimally computed for each object.

Entries.Name: send_content_md5
Entries.FieldDesc: If enabled, a Content-MD5 header is sent with S3 Put Object requests. Consumes more resources to compute the MD5, but may improve compatibility with object storage services that do not support checksums.

Entries.Name: sts_endpoint
Entries.FieldDesc: Accessing S3 resources using temporary, secure credentials provided by AWS Security Token Service.

Entries.Name: max_retries
Entries.FieldDesc: The maximum number of retries for S3 requests that are retryable. Default is 10, set this to 1 to disable retries.

Entries.Name: type
Entries.FieldDesc: Enable AWS Server Side Encryption. Supported values: SSE-KMS, SSE-S3.

Entries.Name: kms_key_id
Entries.FieldDesc: KMS Key ID used to encrypt objects in S3

Entries.Name: kms_encryption_context
Entries.FieldDesc: KMS Encryption Context used for object encryption. It expects JSON formatted string.

Entries.Name: idle_conn_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: The time an idle connection will remain idle before closing.

Entries.Name: response_header_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: The amount of time the client will wait for a servers response headers.

Entries.Name: insecure_skip_verify
Entries.FieldDesc: If the client connects via HTTPS and this option is enabled, the client will accept any certificate and hostname.

Entries.Name: tls_handshake_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum time to wait for a TLS handshake. 0 means no limit.

Entries.Name: expect_continue_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: The time to wait for a server's first response headers after fully writing the request headers if the request has an Expect header. 0 to send the request body immediately.

Entries.Name: max_idle_connections
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum number of idle (keep-alive) connections across all hosts. 0 means no limit.

Entries.Name: max_idle_connections_per_host
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum number of idle (keep-alive) connections to keep per-host. If 0, a built-in default value is used.

Entries.Name: max_connections_per_host
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum number of connections per host. 0 means no limit.

Entries.Name: tls_ca_path
Entries.FieldDesc: Path to the CA certificates to validate server certificate against. If not set, the host's root CA certificates are used.

Entries.Name: tls_cert_path
Entries.FieldDesc: Path to the client certificate, which will be used for authenticating with the server. Also requires the key path to be configured.

Entries.Name: tls_key_path
Entries.FieldDesc: Path to the key for the client certificate. Also requires the client certificate to be configured.

Entries.Name: tls_server_name
Entries.FieldDesc: Override the expected name on the server certificate.

Entries.Name: enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: When enabled, low-level S3 HTTP operation information is logged at the debug level.

Entries.Name: bucket_name
Entries.FieldDesc: GCS bucket name

Entries.Name: service_account
Entries.FieldDesc:
JSON either from a Google Developers Console client_credentials.json file, or a Google Developers service account key. Needs to be valid JSON, not a filesystem path. If empty, fallback to Google default logic:
1. A JSON file whose path is specified by the GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIALS environment variable. For workload identity federation, refer to https://cloud.google.com/iam/docs/how-to#using-workload-identity-federation on how to generate the JSON configuration file for on-prem/non-Google cloud platforms.
2. A JSON file in a location known to the gcloud command-line tool: $HOME/.config/gcloud/application_default_credentials.json.
3. On Google Compute Engine it fetches credentials from the metadata server.

Entries.Name: chunk_buffer_size
Entries.FieldDesc: The maximum size of the buffer that GCS client for a single PUT request. 0 to disable buffering.

Entries.Name: max_retries
Entries.FieldDesc: The maximum number of retries for idempotent operations. Overrides the default gcs storage client behavior if this value is greater than 0. Set this to 1 to disable retries.

Entries.Name: account_name
Entries.FieldDesc: Azure storage account name

Entries.Name: account_key
Entries.FieldDesc: Azure storage account key. If unset, Azure managed identities will be used for authentication instead.

Entries.Name: connection_string
Entries.FieldDesc: If `connection-string` is set, the value of `endpoint-suffix` will not be used. Use this method over `account-key` if you need to authenticate via a SAS token. Or if you use the Azurite emulator.

Entries.Name: container_name
Entries.FieldDesc: Azure storage container name

Entries.Name: endpoint_suffix
Entries.FieldDesc: Azure storage endpoint suffix without schema. The account name will be prefixed to this value to create the FQDN. If set to empty string, default endpoint suffix is used.

Entries.Name: max_retries
Entries.FieldDesc: Number of retries for recoverable errors

Entries.Name: user_assigned_id
Entries.FieldDesc: User assigned managed identity. If empty, then System assigned identity is used.

Entries.Name: chunk_delimiter
Entries.FieldDesc: Delimiter used to replace ':' in chunk IDs when storing chunks

Entries.Name: application_credential_id
Entries.FieldDesc: OpenStack Swift application credential id

Entries.Name: application_credential_name
Entries.FieldDesc: OpenStack Swift application credential name

Entries.Name: application_credential_secret
Entries.FieldDesc: OpenStack Swift application credential secret

Entries.Name: auth_version
Entries.FieldDesc: OpenStack Swift authentication API version. 0 to autodetect.

Entries.Name: auth_url
Entries.FieldDesc: OpenStack Swift authentication URL

Entries.Name: username
Entries.FieldDesc: OpenStack Swift username.

Entries.Name: user_domain_name
Entries.FieldDesc: OpenStack Swift user's domain name.

Entries.Name: user_domain_id
Entries.FieldDesc: OpenStack Swift user's domain ID.

Entries.Name: user_id
Entries.FieldDesc: OpenStack Swift user ID.

Entries.Name: password
Entries.FieldDesc: OpenStack Swift API key.

Entries.Name: domain_id
Entries.FieldDesc: OpenStack Swift user's domain ID.

Entries.Name: domain_name
Entries.FieldDesc: OpenStack Swift user's domain name.

Entries.Name: project_id
Entries.FieldDesc: OpenStack Swift project ID (v2,v3 auth only).

Entries.Name: project_name
Entries.FieldDesc: OpenStack Swift project name (v2,v3 auth only).

Entries.Name: project_domain_id
Entries.FieldDesc: ID of the OpenStack Swift project's domain (v3 auth only), only needed if it differs the from user domain.

Entries.Name: project_domain_name
Entries.FieldDesc: Name of the OpenStack Swift project's domain (v3 auth only), only needed if it differs from the user domain.

Entries.Name: region_name
Entries.FieldDesc: OpenStack Swift Region to use (v2,v3 auth only).

Entries.Name: container_name
Entries.FieldDesc: Name of the OpenStack Swift container to put chunks in.

Entries.Name: max_retries
Entries.FieldDesc: Max retries on requests error.

Entries.Name: connect_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: Time after which a connection attempt is aborted.

Entries.Name: request_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: Time after which an idle request is aborted. The timeout watchdog is reset each time some data is received, so the timeout triggers after X time no data is received on a request.

Entries.Name: idle_conn_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: The time an idle connection will remain idle before closing.

Entries.Name: response_header_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: The amount of time the client will wait for a servers response headers.

Entries.Name: insecure_skip_verify
Entries.FieldDesc: If the client connects via HTTPS and this option is enabled, the client will accept any certificate and hostname.

Entries.Name: tls_handshake_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum time to wait for a TLS handshake. 0 means no limit.

Entries.Name: expect_continue_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: The time to wait for a server's first response headers after fully writing the request headers if the request has an Expect header. 0 to send the request body immediately.

Entries.Name: max_idle_connections
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum number of idle (keep-alive) connections across all hosts. 0 means no limit.

Entries.Name: max_idle_connections_per_host
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum number of idle (keep-alive) connections to keep per-host. If 0, a built-in default value is used.

Entries.Name: max_connections_per_host
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum number of connections per host. 0 means no limit.

Entries.Name: tls_ca_path
Entries.FieldDesc: Path to the CA certificates to validate server certificate against. If not set, the host's root CA certificates are used.

Entries.Name: tls_cert_path
Entries.FieldDesc: Path to the client certificate, which will be used for authenticating with the server. Also requires the key path to be configured.

Entries.Name: tls_key_path
Entries.FieldDesc: Path to the key for the client certificate. Also requires the client certificate to be configured.

Entries.Name: tls_server_name
Entries.FieldDesc: Override the expected name on the server certificate.

Entries.Name: dir
Entries.FieldDesc: Local filesystem storage directory.

Entries.Name: endpoint
Entries.FieldDesc: Endpoint to connect to.

Entries.Name: bucket
Entries.FieldDesc: Name of OSS bucket.

Entries.Name: access_key_id
Entries.FieldDesc: alibabacloud Access Key ID

Entries.Name: access_key_secret
Entries.FieldDesc: alibabacloud Secret Access Key

Entries.Name: bucket
Entries.FieldDesc: Name of BOS bucket.

Entries.Name: endpoint
Entries.FieldDesc: BOS endpoint to connect to.

Entries.Name: access_key
Entries.FieldDesc: Baidu Cloud Engine (BCE) Access Key ID.

Entries.Name: secret_key
Entries.FieldDesc: Baidu Cloud Engine (BCE) Secret Access Key.

Entries.Name: storage_prefix
Entries.FieldDesc: Prefix for all objects stored in the backend storage. For simplicity, it may only contain digits, English alphabet letters and dashes.

Entries.BlockDesc:
The thanos_object_store_config block configures the connection to object storage backend using thanos-io/objstore clients. This will become the default way of configuring object store clients in future releases.
Currently this is opt-in and takes effect only when `-use-thanos-objstore` is set to true.

Entries.Name: store
Entries.FieldDesc: Backend storage to use for the ring. Supported values are: consul, etcd, inmemory, memberlist, multi.

Entries.Name: prefix
Entries.FieldDesc: The prefix for the keys in the store. Should end with a /.

Entries.Name: consul

Block.Name: consul
Block.Desc: Configuration for a Consul client. Only applies if the selected kvstore is consul.

Entries.Name: host
Entries.FieldDesc: Hostname and port of Consul.

Entries.Name: acl_token
Entries.FieldDesc: ACL Token used to interact with Consul.

Entries.Name: http_client_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: HTTP timeout when talking to Consul

Entries.Name: consistent_reads
Entries.FieldDesc: Enable consistent reads to Consul.

Entries.Name: watch_rate_limit
Entries.FieldDesc: Rate limit when watching key or prefix in Consul, in requests per second. 0 disables the rate limit.

Entries.Name: watch_burst_size
Entries.FieldDesc: Burst size used in rate limit. Values less than 1 are treated as 1.

Entries.Name: cas_retry_delay
Entries.FieldDesc: Maximum duration to wait before retrying a Compare And Swap (CAS) operation.

Entries.BlockDesc: Configuration for a Consul client. Only applies if the selected kvstore is consul.

Entries.Name: etcd

Block.Name: etcd
Block.Desc: Configuration for an ETCD v3 client. Only applies if the selected kvstore is etcd.

Entries.Name: endpoints
Entries.FieldDesc: The etcd endpoints to connect to.

Entries.Name: dial_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: The dial timeout for the etcd connection.

Entries.Name: max_retries
Entries.FieldDesc: The maximum number of retries to do for failed ops.

Entries.Name: tls_enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: Enable TLS.

Block.Name: tls_config
Block.Desc: The TLS configuration.

Entries.Name: tls_cert_path
Entries.FieldDesc: Path to the client certificate, which will be used for authenticating with the server. Also requires the key path to be configured.

Entries.Name: tls_key_path
Entries.FieldDesc: Path to the key for the client certificate. Also requires the client certificate to be configured.

Entries.Name: tls_ca_path
Entries.FieldDesc: Path to the CA certificates to validate server certificate against. If not set, the host's root CA certificates are used.

Entries.Name: tls_server_name
Entries.FieldDesc: Override the expected name on the server certificate.

Entries.Name: tls_insecure_skip_verify
Entries.FieldDesc: Skip validating server certificate.

Entries.Name: tls_cipher_suites
Entries.FieldDesc:
Override the default cipher suite list (separated by commas). Allowed values:

Secure Ciphers:
- TLS_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
- TLS_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
- TLS_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256

Insecure Ciphers:
- TLS_RSA_WITH_RC4_128_SHA
- TLS_RSA_WITH_3DES_EDE_CBC_SHA
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_RC4_128_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_RC4_128_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_3DES_EDE_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256

Entries.Name: tls_min_version
Entries.FieldDesc: Override the default minimum TLS version. Allowed values: VersionTLS10, VersionTLS11, VersionTLS12, VersionTLS13

Entries.BlockDesc: The TLS configuration.

Entries.Name: username
Entries.FieldDesc: Etcd username.

Entries.Name: password
Entries.FieldDesc: Etcd password.

Entries.BlockDesc: Configuration for an ETCD v3 client. Only applies if the selected kvstore is etcd.

Entries.Name: primary
Entries.FieldDesc: Primary backend storage used by multi-client.

Entries.Name: secondary
Entries.FieldDesc: Secondary backend storage used by multi-client.

Entries.Name: mirror_enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: Mirror writes to secondary store.

Entries.Name: mirror_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: Timeout for storing value to secondary store.

Entries.Name: heartbeat_period
Entries.FieldDesc: Period at which to heartbeat to the ring. 0 = disabled.

Entries.Name: heartbeat_timeout
Entries.FieldDesc: The heartbeat timeout after which compactors are considered unhealthy within the ring. 0 = never (timeout disabled).

Entries.Name: tokens_file_path
Entries.FieldDesc: File path where tokens are stored. If empty, tokens are not stored at shutdown and restored at startup.

Entries.Name: zone_awareness_enabled
Entries.FieldDesc: True to enable zone-awareness and replicate blocks across different availability zones.

Entries.Name: num_tokens
Entries.FieldDesc: Number of tokens to own in the ring.

Entries.Name: replication_factor
Entries.FieldDesc: Factor for data replication.

Entries.Name: instance_id
Entries.FieldDesc: Instance ID to register in the ring.

Entries.Name: instance_interface_names
Entries.FieldDesc: Name of network interface to read address from.

Entries.Name: instance_port
Entries.FieldDesc: Port to advertise in the ring (defaults to server.grpc-listen-port).

Entries.Name: instance_addr
Entries.FieldDesc: IP address to advertise in the ring.

Entries.Name: instance_availability_zone
Entries.FieldDesc: The availability zone where this instance is running. Required if zone-awareness is enabled.

Entries.Name: instance_enable_ipv6
Entries.FieldDesc: Enable using a IPv6 instance address.

Entries.Name: compactor_address
Entries.FieldDesc: the http address of the compactor in the form http://host:port

Entries.Name: compactor_grpc_address
Entries.FieldDesc: the grpc address of the compactor in the form host:port

Entries.BlockDesc: Common configuration to be shared between multiple modules. If a more specific configuration is given in other sections, the related configuration within this section will be ignored.

Entries.Name: shutdown_delay
Entries.FieldDesc: How long to wait between SIGTERM and shutdown. After receiving SIGTERM, Loki will report 503 Service Unavailable status via /ready endpoint.

Entries.Name: metrics_namespace
Entries.FieldDesc: Namespace of the metrics that in previous releases had cortex as namespace. This setting is deprecated and will be removed in the next minor release.
